text: My new favorite spot! Service was the best I've had in the city. They knew almost every customer by name.  Felt like I was at a family breakfast.  Introduced themselves and asked our names so they'd remember us next time, made our kiddos feel special.  Food was awesome!!! Well be back!
Terrific food and excellent service!!!  Ben there twice and haven't disappointed.

Awesome! I got one of their signature skillets and loved it. It's tough to chose because there's over 30 skillets which all sound amazing. Their menu is so long with so many items you're bound to find something you'll love. The inside has an old diner vibe which is A nice change of pace compared to other chicago restaurants. It's also very cheap! Each skillet is big with eggs and toast and only $12. I'd definitely recommend trying this place!
Such a great place! Exceptionally friendly service, good food. Will definitely return.
Great place!  Very friendly staff.  Food was tasty and lots of it.  Had breakfast at the counter 2 eggs over easy ham with hash browns .

Very quick service. Coffee is good. Place is nice. Very busy and noisy  I had the skirt steak with scrambled eggs. The steak was tender and juicy. Definitely delicious. Our waitress was super sweet. Will go here again!

If you're looking for a really great old school diner experience, this is the place! LOVE this place. Started coming a couple of years ago randomly and ALWAYS feel like family when we come in.  Now, even though we've moved downtown, we make the trip to come up for breakfast at least a few times a month. It's our treat to ourselves.  The family owners are a riot. Always funny and old school chicagoans. They'll give you are hard time if you're difficult but it's more like your family busting your chops. On slow days you can get to know the owners and long time staff. On busy days expect to be seated fairly quickly but be nice to the staff. They're efficient and trying to make sure they can accommodate you and everyone else.  The skillets are AMAZING and now that they serve alcohol - the bloody Mary's are the best you'll ever have!

The food and service here is amazing! Probably the best diner experience I've ever had. The owner was friendly and the wait staff was very nice. Unfortunately I don't live in Chicago, if I did I would probably come here all the time.

This is our go to breakfast place in the neighborhood.  Have eaten here many a time and never been disappointed.  Their skillets are amazing.  Everytime I have had to wait longer than they quoted they have appologized and given me something for my wait.  The owner is very friendly and it is a great family place.

Casual, affordable and yummy comfort food. There are so many choices on the menu. The skillets are big enough for two and there are lots of options. Servers are friendly, we got seated at about 10am with no wait on a Saturday morning, so that's a win in my book. Overall a great place for a casual brunch where everyone will find something to enjoy!
Sat outside in the sunshine eating breakfast - what more could you want. An entire page of skillets to choose from and good sized portions. A very family friendly place to grab breakfast.

S&G is now a weekly spot for me to go for a solid breakfast. The owners are some of the nicest people you will ever meet. Every time I enter I am greeted with a smile and quick seating. The food is great, but large. You will leave feeling extremely full, which is never a bad thing. I would come here daily if I could. Also, the menu is huge, so try your best to at least get one skillet!
Great food great service feel like at home. Best wishes to John and Fran from Grace and Jared and Flavia & Johnny Otarola.

Super cute little neighborhood diner!! Service was amazing. She noticed that we were from out of town so after eating she gave us recommendations for other cool places to eat around the neighborhood and places to check out.  If you're checking this place out don't look any further than the skillet page. Probably 30 different skillets and each looks better than the last.

I come here after German mass on Sundays and it's almost always packed. I don't mind waiting but it can get a bit hectic because there are so many tables and people bustling about that if you are a with a group of 4 or more I recommend NOT coming at peak times with the after-church crowd.  The food is decent - the omelettes and skillets are a bit greasy for my taste, the pancakes are good, the whipped butter is delightful - the coffee is strong (and bottomless, if you don't tell them no, you will have 15 cups of coffee before you know it) and the menu has so many options! They even offer beer, mimosas and bloodys if you're feeling frisky.  I wish I could give this place more stars but because of the grease (we've had tummy aches post-meal), the crowds and the grumpy owners, I feel two stars is justified. I know he deals with a lot of people and I never like writing about service unless it's consistently poor, but the owner makes me feel like I'm a bad kid who is holding up the line. He doesn't greet you in the friendliest manner and he once flat out rudely stated he can't split checks without explaining what we should do. I have no problem with the not splitting checks part - it was the way he talked to me that I disliked. We figured it out on our own and all was well, but I feel like they need to make that policy clear. Write it on the menu or train the servers to tell people they will only split checks if you ask at the table and not at the register.  It's a conveniently located breakfast spot when you leave St. Al's. Maybe we'll try the Golden Nugget or Apple place on the other side of the street next time...

Right off the bat, a family owned restaurant is definitely a highlight for me. The mother daughter duo we met were really friendly and funny and made sure we had everything we needed. They had forgotten to take our order but once they figured it out, they were really apologetic and sweet about it. This is the kind of place where they hug their regulars and was definitely a place I'd come back to. The skillets were pretty good but not a huge fan of the chocolate chip pancakes. Will def be back!

Good ole S&G's! Me and my girlfriend have been here a number of times and the food never disappoints. The skillets are delicious, but don't ask me about anything else...'cause all we get are skillets lol. But more than the food there are two other things I like, 1. the staff is great and it has a very "welcome home"/ small hometown/ "everybody knows your name" kinda feel; and 2. I like the fact that the female servers range in age and it doesn't fit into that false "we need young and hot" ideology, that some businesses think they need. It's about a local feel, with great service. Thumbs up!

I loved this place and definitely will be back! I was here the week of Christmas while visiting my boyfriend's family. It was not far at all from where we were staying. The vibe here is definitely like a family restaurant kind of a vibe. I loved how intimate and busy the little place was. My boyfriend and I came here for breakfast on a date and it was a lovely experience. The server was attentive and the food was delicious. I can't wait to return.

It's always great to have a reliable brunch spot to go to especially when you are planning something last minute. Thankfully S&G is that place! Once you walk in there is someone leading you right away to a seat and then someone is there with water and menus within a minute of you sitting down. There might be a wait on the weekends especially on Sunday but since there are a lot of spots and they serve the food fast, the wait is not too long.  The few times that I have been here, I've ordered the waffles and a few skillets. Waffles are delicious and simple which is how I like them. They have an insane list of skillets, a full page long, probably close to 20 or more. The skillets are great and huge so it is a great choice if you want a little bit of everything. Definitely check this place out if you want some hearty breakfast food, good service in a family style diner environment (very family friendly).

The first and only time I have ever been here, I was greeted warmly by staff and taken to a table right away although it was very busy on a Saturday morning. The skillets are amazing. I will def be going back very soon.

Have to echo other reviews about the cranky, rude owner guy. He is indeed very cranky and rude, and you'd better hope you don't have to deal with him. I've been there twice, and both times I saw very rude behavior from that guy, to the point I didn't want to come back. What an @-hole. He IS very friendly to his "regulars" and I'm sure they've earned some loyalty that way, but if you're not a regular you definitely feel like just some schmuck. The food is fine, but there are a ton of old diners just as good or better (Golden Apple across the street, for one). I'll say, my servers were not a problem, pleasant and friendly, but with that old goomba-looking owner hulking around the place it just ruins everything.
What a place! Going for breakfast? Great portions that are tasty and unique. The owners are there running the place working the line of hungry people waiting. Prices are excellent!

I came into Sam and Georges looking for a skillet and apparently I came to the right. the third page of the menu is devoted to skillets. The skillet I ordered had mushrooms, onion, peppers, and and American cheese. The Veggies were fresh and the skillet was over all very good. Service was also very good.

Sam & George's is basically down the street from my house and if you're having a rough Saturday morning due to an amazing Friday night, go to S&G's and get the meat lover's skillet (sorry vegans)!  It's definitely not the best breakfast spot but it's 1) convenient 2) reliable and 3) similar to whatever diner you used to go to in your suburb growing up. P.S. They don't accept American Express.

I just want to say thank you so much for taking my cranky baby out of my arms this morning, walking around and showing him the kitchen, and keeping him entertained so that my husband and I could have a peaceful breakfast before he rushed back to work. It meant the world to me and I'm just so appreciative of people like you!  - Lincoln's mommy

Hands down best skillet I've ever had! Was very filling. I was able to get two meals out of it. Wait staff was very friendly. Only issue was we sat by the window and it was freezing. Other than that, the food was great! Cute little family owned restaurant for sure!

It bums me out to write a bad review about this place because I love an old school diner. But, there is no excuse for an owner to treat customers in such a rude and unacceptable manner and to embarass them? No.  I stopped by on a weekend for brunch only because my best friend's Mom had been admitted to intensive care that week and I wanted to bring her liver and onions, which she loves so much - and because  hospital food. There was a long line and we waited patiently. The owner - an unpleasant, mustached, loud Greek man was behind the counter and a call came in as we were waiting. I (and anyone within 10') heard him yell at the person on the other end (who I guess was asking about the wait time) "If you're in a hurry - don't come here!" (click) he hung up on the caller!  It was one of those uncomfortable moments where people don't know how to react (soup Nazi anyone?) so most of us waiting in line or sitting at the counter looked at eachother in amazement and some nervous laughter. I thought, 'Wait, am I at one of those joints where the schtick is to be rude to customers?' If it hadn't been for my friend's Mom - we'd have left then. We were finally seated and I ordered an omelette with hashbrowns 'well done' and a to go of liver and onions for my friend's Mom. My friend had an omelette too. When it came out (finally) the hashbrowns were far from well done or brown for that matter - but the omelette was super brown, dry and over cooked. It just looked extremely unappetizing. My partner in brunch wasn't thrilled with his either. I told the waitress and apologized - because I couldn't eat it and I rarely send things back unless I can't eat it. It's awkward. She said no problem, she would have them re-do it. I would've passed but It was 1 pm by the time we sat down and I hadn't eaten a thing yet. About 5 minutes later the owner walks up and stands  at least 6' away from our table and shouts angrily (loud enough you could here a pin drop afterwards) "We're too busy, we're not going to remake it for you! We'll take take it off your bill, but THAT'S IT!!" And turned on his heels muttering to himself as he stormed back behind the counter. I could still hear him going on about it for a minute or so to himself after he was back behind the counter and we were not close and it was packed. Totally unprofessional. The whole place was looking at us. I could feel the blood rushing to my face from embarrassment. He didn't apologize, ask what the issue was - it was insane! He was so rude, LOUD and dismissive. I was livid. I was so frazzled I ended up with a parking ticket too because I forgot to check my app. Jerk.  I love a good dive and personality - but this was just wrong and this guy owes me an apology. Can't believe this place has 4 stars! Enter at your own risk. As far as me and my friends? NEVER AGAIN.
Love the place.  Just love an old fashioned Chicago Diner where you can get a hamburger and fries. Sometimes simple is best.

Only got the breakfast burrito, but it was super filling! I'd just say that the breakfast burrito is manly ground meat with cheese, rather than an "omelet wrapped in a tortilla" which is what I'm used to, but it's pretty flavorful!  It was my first time here, and the restaurant itself seemed to be really welcoming. Many people walked in and the wait staff greeted them happily on a first name basis, so clearly this place seems to be a local favorite! That's always a good sign.

This place is buuuusy. Loud diner atmosphere and fast paced. I was honestly mesmerized watching the busser fill the water pitchers haha. But it has a small town feel (due to all the regulars?). Service was super friendly and the menu reads like a novel so your options are literally endless. Your coffee cup will never be less than half full. The skillet I got was phenomenal and I could only eat about half of it (pro tip don't forget your left overs in your trunk!). My friend got the skirt steak which was ginormous and boyfriend got another delicious skillet. We had a very short wait but for such a busy place never actually felt rushed. Recommend!!
Jeers to shaming your return customers for not carrying cash...especially during the holidays! We won't be back.

Service was very friendly but food was subpar at best.  Cream of chicken/rice soup -- straight out of a can Poor coffee, cold bacon. Over easy eggs were okay, but really, how is it possible to screw that up. English muffin was the best thing we had.  Oh, and the owner/cook was yelling at people behind the counter, which was great to listen to Not sure how this place has such great reviews on Yelp.

Sam & George's is a welcoming neighborhood diner, with typical breakfast and lunch items. They have decent service, and the place has a welcoming atmosphere. I love the classic look of S&G's: on the corner with windows around both sides. It's not unlike the corner restaurant/bar in the painting Nighthawk: people seem close to each other's even though they may be perfect strangers. The food is pretty good too, but nothing outstanding. The sandwiches are solid, and the egg dishes looked hot, fresh, and delicious, though I didn't try it off my friend's plate.  I would recommend S&G's for a local place to chat. The service is not great but not terrible, and same for the food. But, I wouldn't go out of your way to come here for food/ambiance.

My first time going here, on a whim, and within moments of being here I teared up. I'm such a sap, but hear me out. I'm from the mountains out east and there's a sort of welcome there that I haven't found anywhere in Chicago until I came to this little place. I immediately felt at home when I walked in and the woman at the counter treated me like I'd been there a million times. My server was relaxed and warm and told me what was up. It was real people being genuine, which I value so strongly. The food was delicious, the service was prompt and thorough. And the cherry on top? The song that played when I walked in was John Denver's Take Me Home Country Roads. Now you see why I teared up. Granted, that last part is purely by chance, but hot damn if that wasn't the best customer experience I've had in a very long time! I talked to the woman that I encountered when I first came in and throughout our conversation, she mentioned that S&G's is not open on major holidays which I want to applaud. A business that cares about their employees. So freaking awesome. I'm sure I'm gonna become a regular now. No wonder this place has been in business for 60 years.

One of my favorite places in the city. BIG variety in menu choices. Goes from burgers steak to breakfast. John your greater at the door always makes you feel as if your coming back from vacation. Very welcoming and always happy. Food is good service is good. Have NOT been disappointed yet. ENJOY!!!
We had breakfast here, I had the Avocado skillet. Very nice food, and the staff working are really friendly and welcoming. Really good service! Highly Recommend this place!

Good regular diner with nice servers! I ordered a veggie skillet which was really delicious and more than filling. The place is a little expensive for a diner though and it was hard to get our servers attention given the small number of people in the diner. Other than that - good food!
This is my new go-to for brunch. I love introducing people to this place! They win in both the customer service and food categories! I'm personally a huge fan of the skillets. Get the combo!

Would not recommend using them for carry out orders. Was told it would be ready in ten to fifteen minutes. After showing up 15 minutes later they said it would be another fifteen minuets. Waited 15 minutes and went back in the order was still not ready and John the owner said he had no idea when it would be ready. I understand if you're busy but just let us know. Left without getting our food. Will be going to Golden Nugget across the street next time.
Excellent service and ridiculously good food. I felt like a neighbor, not a tourist. I even brought in my friends the next day so I could eat there again. Thanks Sam & George!

This place is legit. Traditional diner at its finest. We only had to wait five minutes, and this place was busy. A well oiled machine designed to satisfy all of your breakfast needs. Everyone was super nice and super efficient, and the food was delicious.
Not only was the service here amazing - quick food delivery, very kind staff - the food was also delicious! 5 stars all around

I love this place and the people who work here are friendly and welcoming.  If you're really hungry, order a skillet. Any kind.  To be honest, I've only ordered breakfast food and everything tastes like it should. I'm sure the lunch items are just as good.

Thanks Yelp. Looking for a place to eat and out pops this recommendation. It turns out this is an old fashioned Greek owned dinner with good food at reasonable prices. Turns out I knew the owners too. If you are tired of franchised food and want a friendly atmosphere this is the place to go.
This is the best place in Chicago to eat. Live in the area and never met any one who does not like this place. If you are just visiting Chicago it it a great place to go great skillets too.

I live down the street and would come here super frequently for breakfast. I don't plan on coming back any time soon, I was parking my car nearby and a woman in the car in front of me backed into me hitting my car, no apology or anything and intended to drive off until i honked at her before she got out of her spot. She decided to get out of her car and yell at me IN her Sam & George's shirt.....I'm surprised she didn't recognize me since she's almost always the one ringing me up at the end of my meal. Don't really plan on coming back after that.
The food and service were excellent. The prices seemed a bit high, but the portions were proportional. My veggie omelet was easily 2 meals worth of food. An excellent breakfast or brunch stop.

I stopped at S&G's before a facial appointment on a weekday morning. I absolutely love these types of diners: homey, and full of regulars that seem to know all the details about the daily lives of the workers and vice versa. I ordered the Star Spangled Skillet and opted for a biscuit instead of toast (because why not?!) I really enjoyed the skillet! My only complaint was that the potatoes underneath were not seasoned at all. I hate adding salt to my dish after all of the ingredients blend together because IMO it alters the dish to taste like nothing but salt. Had the hashbrowns been adequately salted before wedding the peppers, onions, tomatoes, italian sausage, and mozzarella, the dish would have been perfect. The biscuit was definitely not made from scratch, but it got the job done. I was not blown away by the food here but I was not underwhelmed. Overall a decent experience that served its purpose.

This is my go-to spot when I want a wholesome meal for a reasonable price. I usually grab a spot a the bar, scroll through my weekly news articles, and chomp down on a skillet bowl with pancakes. The atmosphere reminds me of my Jersey which is notorious for diners. Parking is a bit difficult as the restaurant is in the middle of busy intersection. I normally park about 3-4 streets behind and enjoy the nice in Lakeview. FYI - Bring cash for the tip

I agree with everyone's comments about this being a classic diner with a lot of history, and I think the food is generally very good (if not amazing). One thing that always bothers me is how they handle card payments. You pay up front at the register and if you pay by card, they ask "are you leaving a tip with cash or on the card?" Like many people I don't generally carry cash anymore so I say "on the card," then they ask "how much?" and enter it directly into the card machine. So you're forced to declare your tip verbally, often in listening proximity of several people. At all restaurants I give a decent tip of around 20% (unless I have a very good reason not to) so it's not that I feel pressure to give a good tip, or that I would like to stiff the server and feel deprived of this opportunity. It's just, why do it this way? Why not let people write their tip on the payment slip like everywhere else? It just feels off-color to force diners to say the tip out loud. Whatever, maybe a silly complaint to some but it's a shame to cap off a good dining experience with something kind of weird and off-putting like that.

Friendly staff, but the meatloaf entree was a little bland. The mashed potatoes and peas that came as sides were awful. Watery mashed potatoes, and the gravy didn't help. Also there was an oscillating fan over my booth and it sounded like a woodpecker was in the wall. Very unnerving. I would eat here again if I lived nearby and wanted something quick, like breakfast, but I'm not recommending. Love the staff, though!!!

We walked in with limited time to get something good to eat.  It was at an off hour so there were only a few others inside, but we got a warm welcome as we came in.  After communicating our needs to our friendly server, we got: Very comfy booth seating next to the window Super efficient & fast service! A great turkey burger, ripe avocado, fresh fruit My ideal skirt steak & eggs (rare, juicy, flavorful, seasoned perfectly, and HUGE steak, perfectly poached medium eggs) Sourdough toast w/butter & a jam selection The check was on the table with out meal, & we got out of there with 5 minutes to spare even. And we got a warm thank you & big smiles heading out the door. Imo, that is the epitome of 5 stars!  Thanks guys!

This is my favorite brunch place in Chicago! The wait is usually only 10 -15 mins and trust, it is worth it. The Greeks surely know how to do brunch. If you a stag look for/ listen for a free seat at the counter, you will thank me later. Outdoor seating is available and it is worth the wait as well. As for food recommendations: the egg skillet dishes are amazing especially The "Combo"! If I could give S&G more than 5 stars, I certainly would. And finally, if Frances, the hostess is there, greet her heartily and she will treat you like royalty. :) Enjoy!

Classic diner with an exceptionally friendly staff and great service. The menu is a small novel (as it should be at any good diner) so there is something for everyone. Not technically BYOB, but we did anyway and our server had absolutely no issues with it (and, in fact, seemed a little excited about it). This is not a fancy place, or even a "nice" place. It's been around forever and the decor reflects that, but it's clean and cozy. For what S&G lacks in aesthetics, it makes up for in portion sizes, which are HUGE. We ordered a Godfather skillet (which S&G is known for) and the bagel/lox and had leftovers for the next 2 days. In sum, this place is the basic chick of the breakfast game and the food isn't anything above your standard diner fare, but it's a good place to go for a decent meal at a reasonable price without a wait.
Solid food, the owners are super nice, it's great for breakfast and brunch if you want something simple and hearty.

I have to say, I was originally sad that there weren't more options for 5am on a Sunday, but I found Sam & George's on yelp and I'm glad I did. After a 4:30am arrival from the airport after 11 hours of flying, we were hungry...quite hungry and also tired.  We were going to go to our tried and true breakfast spot, but it was unfortunately...closed that early. So, we stopped in here and were greeted warmly and got to pick a nice little booth to sit in.   I had the avocado skillet with a bagel.  WOW.  It was delicious, fresh, and not greasy (like many diner skillets).  It was also huge, so I managed to take half home for lunch.  Prices are reasonable. Quick and friendly coffee refills with great staff and delicious food!  I will definitely be back!

Having breakfast somewhere else today made me realize (1) how much I LOVE S and G and (2) that I had never posted a review - oh dear. It took Salt and Pepper closing a few years ago to get me here.I LOVE THIS PLACE! Friendly, old-timey. diner-y service. HUGE menu with some items not normally seen (biscuits and gravy, corned beef hash, etc). The options are mind boggling - but whatever eggs/omelets I order, the food can't be beat. Great family place, always dependable. My "go to", affordable, not fancy but THE BEST breakfast place.

Great lil diner in Lakeview. This place has been around for a while - once you walk in that's obvious. The menu is crazy long and overwhelming, as a diner's should be. The portions are gigantic, even for Chicago standards. The skillets are what they're known for, and they are amazing. I got The Godfather and it was great. This isn't a 'sceney' place for breakfast but it is delicious and very homey.

Veal Parmesan they serve with no cheese or sauce and a club sandwich with no bacon was only part of the problem I felt like I want on the island of misfit menu items. The food was mediocre at best the soups were bland and watery and the fries were well under done. The waitress was nice but she did not know the menu or what the dishes were suppose to be. Veal parm came out with no cheese or sauce and we were told that's how they serve it when we inquiry. Well then that's not veal parmesan. I tried to order a turkey club but was told they did not have a turkey sandwich with bacon so I ordered s sliced turkey but then got a club. If you work as a waiter at a restaurant learn the menu. The interior is kinda like a worn down banquet hall but I will say they have a few cool old pics. We did come for dinner Saturday and I think the A staff and cook are more the breakfast brunch people. Dinner I'd never go back for again there are to many other places In the area that on a bad day are a lot better.

Ended up here after a nearby brunch place had over an hour wait for two people. For being a back-up choice, it was pretty good! My friend got a scramble that was very yummy, and I got chicken and waffles. It wasn't anything too special, but it was still good breakfast food! Prices were reasonable and the service was pretty good, as well. Definitely reminded me of breakfast places from my childhood!

It's my go-to breakfast place. It's crowded on weekends, so I go on weekdays and grab a stool at the counter.  They keep me full-up on coffee, the OJ is fresh squeezed, and there's good conversation.  Check out the breakfast specials -- smaller portions at a very reasonable price.

The only good thing is the the waitresses who are very nice. Unfortunately the food is not very good and the owner is very rude.  He screams in front of the customers and curses out the staff. Great restaurant across the street called Golden Nugget. Great food and nice people - go there instead.

Typical Greek diner. Been here forever. Very large menu and everything a little better than competitors. Service & family atmosphere the BEST!!!  It seems like most diners are regulars who have been coming here for years.

Skillet was very good. The hash browns are not well done here so not the crispy style. The cinnamon French toast was cinnamon with French toast, expected more. No wait time and good service. Enjoyed the freshly squeezed orange juice. I would go back again for a home style breakfast / brunch experience.

We love Sam & George's. Great local spot with the comfortable diner vibe. My boyfriend literally won't let us eat anywhere else for breakfast. Another great perk- the owner will calculate your tip for you when you pay if you're not the best at math on your toes (at least I can admit it!)

I used to visit this place when I worked in an office located in the Athenaeum Theatre across the street. The menu had a huge selection of items (typical dinner fare, but some Greek recipes thrown in), the prices were very reasonable and the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating; they treated you like family every time you stopped by. I was particularly a fan of the skillets - which were huge! They also had a really good selection of soups. Everything was tasty and made from scratch. Too bad I no longer work in the area (actually, I hated my old job, so never mind about that), but I would definitely come back if I were in the neighborhood. This is definitely one of the better breakfast spots in West Lakeview/Southport area.

Great traditional breakfast spot. The staff seemed to know everyone in the restaurant, and even though it was our first time there, they were very welcoming and friendly, like they knew us too. This spot is a nice switch up from some of the more trendy brunch spots in the city. Come hungry!

Amazing food! Best French toast and skillet I've ever had. All the food was so fresh and the service was phenomenal! Our waitress, Eleni, was very personable which made the experience even better. I would highly recommend this place to anyone!
A niece neighborhood restaurant. Huge menu selection, know for their skillets. The food is good. The chicken wagon wheel soup is very flavorful. The spaghetti is really good, full of flavor too.

Boyfriends family have been going to this place for 20 years, and I finally got a chance to try it out! Service and food is great. I wouldn't go during the weekend though, it is JAM-PACKED. Portions are pretty large.

Solid place for breakfast.  It's a popular spot for locals. You can sense the patron loyalty the moment you step through the doors. The friendly owners greet everyone, ask about family, and make each person feel welcome. The breakfast portions are huge! I ordered the breakfast burrito and while delicious with the flavorful chorizo, it was too much to eat. Didn't take much convincing for my husband to help finish it off though. The fruit plate looked colorful and refreshing (didn't get it, but it looked good). If you are looking for a family-feel diner, this is the place!
Been here tons of times for breakfast and brunch. I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a table. Cute outdoor seating. The servers are all wonderful and make you feel super welcome.

The owners or management are always very pleasant and it's always easy to get a seat here. This is basic diner food so that is the only reason for 3 stars. However it's the best diner food in the surrounding area.

Great breakfast/brunch spot. Food servings were huge, and everything fresh and delicious. Greasy, buttery kinda breakfast (don't hope for healthy here!). Service was good - everyone was very nice. Will definitely go back for breakfast/brunch, next time when I have a hangover and need greasy food!

Wanted to checkout a new breakfast place when in the city, so decided to head up to Lakeview and check out Sam & George's. Great place and did not disappoint!  Went in on a Sunday morning and was sat right away. Had an old school feel to it, which was nice because we weren't exactly looking for a modern place to go to (ex. Yelp). If you are going there for breakfast, go for the skillets! They have an entire page of skillets available for whatever you are looking for. I ordered a chicken skillet which included hash browns, grilled chicken, swiss cheese and eggs on top. So good and couldn't even finish it because the portions were so big! Great value for the price and would visit again!

We stumbled in after a nearby place quoted an hour wait. We waited maybe five minutes here! Great typical breakfast foods. You'll find everything you could want and walk out full. We each had a skillet and were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed every last bite. Quick, friendly service too! Will definitely be back.

I love love LOVE this place! If you haven't been, yet, you definitely should go. I come here all the time. The staff is so sweet and friendly! They always remember me and make me feel like family.  The food is delicious! I recommend the cheeseburger club or the biscuits and gravy if you're unsure of what to get. It's a little on the pricey side as far as diner food goes, but that is because the portions are HUGE. I go home with another meal each time I visit. You could probably share a dish with another person if you really wanted, but it's so good you might not want to! They have really good coffee, too. Overall, a great place to come with friends for any meal of the day! :)
My favorite breakfast place around. They have the greatest skillets, and it's a very cozy, homey feel. Not your typical, fancy, over-priced breakfast spot- and that's what I love about it.

There's a reason this place has been around for Such a long time. Family owned, fast no nonsense service, and exceptional diner fare. Brunch is the best here, and seating at the bar is entertaining watching the 80s TV which is so refreshing that they have not replaced. This place is like being in a John Hughes movie. Chicago at its best. Places like this are rare these days and I hope they never close. +plus up tip. If you have a hangover, order a cup of chicken soup. You will be temporarily fixed up until your skillet arrives!
Great breakfast and atmosphere!   Old school Chicago Greek place for a good breakfast at a good price.  Always got good service no complaints here.
Waitress was super friendly! We felt so welcomed. Had the ham and cheese omelet and the matts son skillet. So great!

Owner was EXTREMELY rude to our group - made rude comments directly towards us. We thought he was joking at first until it became clear he was being serious. He also yelled at staff in front of customers. Definitely ruined the meal.  Never going back to this place.
Despite the tasty food, the owner's deplorable behavior to staff and visitors made a wonderful meal turn sour.
Very rude and unprofessional. The service was not worth the quality of the food. Owner was rude to the staff and customers alike. The Golden Apple across the street is a much better alternative.

Sometimes I just want a no frills breakfast that reminds me of growing up in my small town in Southern Illinois. S&Gs hits the spot. This place is absolutely wonderful. Be prepared to be overwhelmed by the menu, there's a lot to choose from. It should satisfy everyone's needs! *The skillets are wonderful as well as the chicken fried steak/biscuits and gravy. The gravy is also homemade no box meals here!!

Let me preface this review with I love diners and always tried to see the best in them but this place fell so short.  When you first arrive:  Sam & George's gives the classic diner vibe with ample booths which is a plus. Sam & George's is extremely spacious with tons of seating in the front and in the back room. No matter how busy the restaurant is you will not have to wait too long to be seated.  Service:  The waitress we had was very pleasant but one waitress was extremely overbearing and made my friend and I feel uncomfortable.  Food:  I ordered the avocado skillet which is essentially hash browns, avocado, eggs, toast, and four cheeses.After receiving my food I noticed that they gave me a ton of avocado which is typically a great thing but 70% of the avocado they gave me was brown. I decided to remove the brown avocado and place it on a separate place and a waitress that was nearby started questioning me as to why I didn't eat it. She even tried to force brown avocado on my friend that I was with. She obviously wasn't doing it out of malice but she couldn't take the obvious hit that we wanted her to leave us alone.  Aside from the brown avocado the entire meal was cold and lacked so much flavor. I was both disappointed and impressed with the food. I was disappointed because everything I order was so basic and left little room to mess it up. I was equally impressed because they found a way to mess up a basic skillet and make me dislike my first diner.  Overall:  I wouldn't recommend this place unless you are looking for cheap and mediocre food. Breakfast is the easiest meal to make but Sam & George's has a unique way of making it seem so much more complicated.

Cute little diner that I wandered into after reusing to wait an hour at another brunch place. It was pretty busy, but after about 5 minutes my friend and I were seated. The menu is very extensive with a large variety - typical of a diner. Got a vegetarian omelette with a side of potatoes that was pretty good! Portions were sizable - paid $15 including tax/tip for a full plate (and full stomach) It's hard to mess up breakfast food, so the reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is due to the friendly/quick service and large portions. I'd come again - probably to try a skillet!

Solid breakfast, pretty standard diner food. Service is really fast and the people working there are really nice. Good option if you're looking for a nice quick breakfast, but nothing particularly special.

Fun place and atmosphere.  Staff is definitely entertaining.  Also, the quality of the food is outstanding!  It's your classic diner fare, but with high quality produce, meat, etc.  Best blueberries one ever had.

This place is surprisingly close to where I live, so it's a shock it took me this long to come here.  We came here on a Friday morning, after an entire day of drinking the night before with a group of 6.  My boyfriend picked the spot because he was curious in seeing their huge menu of skillet options.  We both decided on the combo while our friends got an assortment of chicken fried steak, french toast, chicken tender skillets, biscuits and gravy, ham, and bacon from their rather very large menu.  We ordered a ton of food and our waitress was very attentive and able to bring out all the food in a fairly quick amount of time.  I thought the food was pretty good.  It is your typical diner style huge filled plates that leaves you unable to get up from the table because you need to digest.  It was also reasonably priced.  And a pleasant surprise is that for a diner, they have a small outdoor seating area on the side of the restaurant.

Love S&Gs.  Love Johnny and Franny. We prefer to sit at the bartop so we can enjoy the staff. The food is diner food with the family feel.  Their skillets are a sure thing, there are over 20 options. Omelets are top notch, and their english muffins are great.  We have only had breakfast in over 20 visits but based on that I'd certainly be willing to try lunch and dinner. This place makes you feel like people are glad you're there and want you to enjoy your experience.  Johnny is there probably 6 days a week and makes the place.  The kitchen staff also makes a mean homemade tomatillo salsa so if you like green salsa, make sure to ask for some.

We came here for breakfast before leaving for the airport.  It was my mom and I and my 1 year old daughter.  We received outstanding service, the waitstaff, who all appear to be related, made us feel welcome from the moment we stepped foot inside.  Immediately engaging the baby, they asked her name then every time they walked by said hi to her, called her by name, even brought out chicken noodle soup for her.  It was 10am, I figured I was not interested in feeding my kid diner chicken noodle soup, boy was I wrong, it was super flavorful and full of veggies chicken and noodles; my daughter loved it!  The food was good, I had the veggie omelette, and my mom had eggs and pork belly, both very good.  The overall experience and feeling of how I wish I lived here, because I would make this a regular spot is the reason for the 5 stars.  Come here you won't regret it.

I just came back from Sam & George's to write my first Yelp review ever. I'm channeling my inner Stefon when I say, "This place has...everything!" Impeccable service, a friendly diner vibe, but without the greasy diner food. They made you feel like you were a guest in their house. And their menu says they were voted Best Skillet in Chicago...I believe it! I had the Panhandler Skillet which has steak, onions, green peppers and cheese. It was out-of-control delicious. I've been to other diner-like restaurants such as Melrose (which to me is more like a Waffle House) but I absolutely loved Sam & George's. You can get the skillet, and then take it home for another meal. They have healthy options and their ingredients are local and very fresh. Everyone engaged with us...not just our waitress. And it seemed like they knew everyone who came in the door. I would highly recommend and I can't wait to go back! It was most certainly one of the best breakfast experiences I have had in Chicago!

Wonderful diner! Great service, menu full of choices, friendly atmosphere and delicious to boot! PLUS...there are Dum Dum suckers! Will definitely be going back...our go to diner place to relax, and be around genuinely friendly people. :)

If you want good old fashioned dining that's STILL family owned, head here. John and Fran will make you feel like part of the family. The menu is vast and everything is great and they'll accommodate just about anything. New to the menu is pork belly - not to be missed! We don't live in the neighborhood but make the trek from our neighborhood because it's worth it to us.

Sam & George's is great! Very typical diner but with outstanding breakfast (I haven't tried lunch).  We came in on a Sunday afternoon and sat at the bar. Every table inside and outside was full but the line seemed to moving at a good pace! I was so impressed with the entire staff, between servers, bussers, cooks, and management - everything seemed to be aligned. Sitting at the bar we had the opportunity to see their team work right in front of us!  Everyone is super friendly. We got a plain waffle, half order of biscuits and gravy, and the Athenian skillet to share. Both came with a side of fruit (cantaloupe, honeydew, strawberries, blackberries and blueberries).  The skillets here are AMAZING!  We will definitely be back. Everything we had was very good and large portions. Exactly what you want when you come to diner and better skillets and biscuits and gravy than I've had at upscale brunch spots. There were chunks of gyros in the skillet opposed to thin sliced and it made a huge difference! Really delicious.
I want to give them more stars because the food is really good. What's not awesome is charging $17 for a carafe of fresh squeezed OJ. Out of control.

I've visited here twice now, once in June and now in July. The food is Ok to good, depending on what you order. The chopped steak is good. The soups are good. Salad, very nice. Breakfast was .... meh but it was diner food. Certainly better than Ann Sather, another "popular" breakfast place in the area.  However .... I have now found the worst example of customer service on the whole planet. I believe he's the owner. He has white hair and a burry little moustache. During the 65 minutes I was there this week, he *continually* chastised his staff over minor matters. He was very rude to a customer about the doneness of a steak or something he ordered. He moped about the place and generally cast his negative voodoo vibes all over the restaurant. I could not believe how he addressed his staff .... Very rude! This individual needs to retire or go away or something. He made me feel so uncomfortable that I left before I was finished eating. I had indigestion, not from the food, but from his shit-ass attitude.

The bf and I recently took a trip to Chicago for my birthday. After a full, exhausting day of sightseeing, we had brunch reservations down on the river the following morning. But the night before, when we were about to go to sleep - completely exhausted from our 82 mile Chicago walking day - I turned to him and said, "How about we get 4 hours instead of 3 hours of sleep tonight, ditch the schfancy reservation, and walk around Lakeview until we find a place to eat breakfast at?" And that's how we happened upon an incredible breakfast at Sam & George's. At this super duper laid back diner, they specialize in the friendliest, chattiest servers in the world, the freshest fresh-squeezed orange juice in the Americas, and the most robust, incredible egg skillets to have ever graced my lips. It was a beautiful accident ending up at Sam & George's, and the bf will probably still affirm that this was his favorite meal we had in Chicago.

My friend and I have been going to S&G for months now and the experience has always been cute and quaint, like that of a typical American diner.  Last weekend I ordered a their avocado, bacon, lettuce, & tomato sandwich and added cheese.  The waitress taking our order was rushing and looked annoyed after she received word, from the owner (right in the middle of talking to us), that some other customer was in a hurry and she should hurry up with us.  Fine.  We could overlook that. Once the food came, I noticed that my sandwich was missing the cheese.  I waived the waitress over and she took the sandwich back to get it remedied.  The sandwich came back completely falling apart.  There was no way I could hold it.  Furthermore, when I did squish things back into the relative shape of a sandwich, every time I picked it up, all the ingredients would fall right back out. Despite all my attempts, I could no longer ignore the sandwich-less qualities and soggy bread from the side of cole slaw.  I saw the waitress and asked her to remake the sandwich because this one was unsalvageable.  She apologized and took the sandwich back. Within 30 seconds the owner comes over to our table, stands 5 feet away, and starts yelling to us that this is an ABLT and that's just how it is - it will always fall apart.  We calmly replied that an ingredient was forgotten and when the sandwich came back it was in pieces and the bread was soggy.  He continued to shout loud enough for the rest of the customers to hear - "that's what the sandwich is, I'm not making you a new one.... choose something else from the menu because I'm not making you this sandwich again."  How embarrassing and rude!  I felt like a little kid getting reprimanded for being too picky at the dinner table.  The other customers seemed to feel it too as they looked around and down at their plates nervously. I have NEVER experienced such rudeness in any restaurant.  I was willing to put up with his smoking in the restaurant but not with how he spoke to us. We will never be going there again. Notice: the negative reviews of this place usually reference their average/sub-average food or the rude behavior of the owner/manager older man with the mustache.

The price seems a little high for the quality of food. We didn't have good service either, although the staff was extremely friendly. It's not a terrible place for breakfast, but it isn't somewhere I'd try out again.

My friend and I were visiting other friends over the weekend and wanted to try a new brunch place. I was expecting it to be super packed because it was a Saturday morning, but we were seated pretty quickly! The restaurant has a friendly, cozy aura. Our waitress checked in on us a couple of times while we were waiting for the last person to join us. When we ordered the food, it came out pretty quickly - and it was a LOT. I ordered the hash with corned beef with over easy eggs and toast. It was extremely tasty and a sufficient amount of food. I didn't finish it because it was so much, but it gave me plenty of energy for the rest of the day. Just a tip: they prefer it if you can leave tip in cash (they still accept cards though).

The service here was so friendly and welcoming. The food was great too, but it was the people there who will encourage me to go back. We came on a Saturday morning and one of us came about 15 minutes later. Our waitress came by a couple times to check on us while we waited for our late friend. Another waitress who wasn't even assigned to our table also checked with us. They didn't rush us at all either, even though we stayed late too. On top of that, they love if you pay with cash! The cashier said he owes me a beer for having cash with me, so I guess I'll be back!

This place is excellent. The service is by far the best I've ever had. Family friendly, along with great conversation. This neighbor establishment has been in setvice for over 50 years and has been featured on Chicago's Best for there phenomenal Skillets. My favor is the Tex-Mex Skillet with sausage patties added to it. The mixture of favors are superb. I'm going to miss this place once my family relocates to another state. Thanks John Fran and the amazing family of Sam George's for the amazing memories.

Can't beat it. The best food and environment. Usually busy but wait is never over 15 min. I've been there about 15 times atleast. Good! Weekends is when it is busy but wait is short and food comes super fast.

When I'm hungover this is my go to place for breakfast.  The skillets are huge and greasy, reminding me of my favorite college diners.  The food is unpretentious and is exactly what you expect from a local diner.  The menu is huge and the prices are right.  I will be back!
I like this place.  Been here twice for breakfast.  Always good service and the food is pretty good as well.  A good meal at a good price.  It's nothing fancy or flashy, just a regular diner.
Great breakfast and fast service. 27 skillets on the menu that can handle any craving.
Great place! Excellent egg skillets for breakfast. I had the Joe H skillet with veggies and corn beef hash. Very tasty and the service was excellent.
My favorite is the hobo skillet. The lentil soup on Sat is great. I have known John and Fran forever, and they are very good people. Good, hearty food and pleasant atmosphere.
The place is great. I have been there 3 times. Lots of options on menu. The sweets are good too. Fast service, cool owners
Overrated and not worth the wait.  There are better places for breakfast in the area.  The staff is friendly but the owner seems like a bully.

This is a true diner in every since down to the display case at the entrance with the fruit, melon and pies of the day!  I love this place because it offers good food in ample portions served by friendly staff and at very reasonable prices.  Definitely try one of the skillets. For my veggie peeps, the "eggie and veggie" skillet is a must have. Put this place on your brunch line up any weekend.  It is worth it!

We walked in at about 330pm on a Friday and were one of two tables in the place. We were greeted by a lovely older woman who runs the cash register and, perhaps, owns the place as well? The decor was wonderful and hilarious. It reminded me of a granny's kitchen with photos of family up and old items and various collected decor. The whole place just made me smile as it seems like a lot of love and family tradition is put into it. It could probably use a make over but I think that would take away the charm. Our server was very sweet and helpful. Did a great job! The fresh squeezed orange juice is excellent. We both had skillets which were good. Nothing exceptional, but a well done meal all in all. I give four stars for the welcoming atmosphere and friendly service. Also great windows for people watching!

Went today for a late breakfast..Parking a little difficult but always is in Chicago. They seated us right away, waitress very nice and extremely knowledgeable about the choices. My husband and I both had the skillets..So much food and delicious. I had the one with the hash perfect alot to eat but loved every bite. My husband had the one with steak he too enjoyed it. Ate it all. We will definitely go back..

Great old school diner.  Have been here twice and both times left full and happy.  The breakfast burrito was one of the best I've ever had, and I'm from Texas.  I ordered a hash the second time I went, which was very good, I ate the whole thing, but I still kind of wished I had ordered the breakfast burrito again because I just loved it so much (Also, the hash at White Palace Grill I think might just be unbeatable, so I've learned my lesson trying to order a hash from somewhere else).  Husband gets the french toast and bacon and is always pleased.  Only thing I've tried that I probably wouldn't order again were the biscuits and gravy.  I AM a biscuits and gravy snob, so they were fine, but, nothing special. Overall, great classic diner joint that has become one of our staple go to when we want a good, old fashioned, non-pretentious breakfast.

I went to catch up with a friend and he suggested this place. The parking in this area was surprisingly easy to find on a Saturday. The interior had an older feel but i didn't mind it. That's what diners are supposed to feel like. I ordered some Pigs in a Blanket pancakes- a pancake wrapped (burrito style) around a sausage link. In my opinion, they were okay. The pancakes were a little bitter because they were overcooked. The sausage link inside was small so i didn't get a good pancake to sausage ratio. The service was great though, but the food was alright; the place did its job and fed us.

I tried preparing myself the night before looking at this huge menu so that I could narrow it down by the time I got to the restaurant in the morning, but I was still indecisive. We got there pretty early at about 8:30am and were seated at a table right away. Our waitress, Anne, was very on top of things. She came by 3 times, and I finally decided on the Veggie Omelet with a side of bacon, fruit, and a half stack of pancakes. Yep, the Veggie Omelet came with a side of hashbrowns as well, and I ate all of this - except  for one pancake. It was pretty solid. I love the homey diner feel here, and the staff was all very friendly and appreciative of the business. The refills kept coming, and the plates were cleared to make room on the table.

Went here on a busy Sunday morning (3/1/15), but the staff was efficient in turning tables and keeping people moving.  Waited about 10 minutes to be seated, which wasn't bad given the crowd. I got the corned beef hash with eggs over easy and a fresh-squeezed OJ.  Greasy and delicious in the way a diner breakfast should be.  I buffed my plate clean with the accompanying rye toast and washed it all down with the very fresh OJ. Exactly what I wanted from a diner: good service, food that gets the endorphin flowing, and the budding commotion of a neighborhood starting their morning.

Im in from Texas and was recommended this place oh man the skillets are amazing i ordered the hobo with ham and it was so good definitely going back for  another before we leave back.  This place was crazy packed but worth the wait.

I actually found this place from looking at reviews on here. I wanted to go somewhere other than Ann Sather (which I do not find anything wrong with, but I have been there a million times and wanted to change things up).  I think that the overall aesthetics of the restaurant really appealed to me, being that it felt like a "greasy spoon" ma and pop type diner. The menu had pretty standard breakfast options with a pretty huge selection of skillet options. I got the "Godfather" which has Italian sausage, onion, hash brown, and mozzarella cheese. At first, I thought it tasted a bit bland, but I added a little ketchup on it and it was good to go.  I definitely agree with the post about feeling a bit rushed. The waiter kept coming to the table asking my friend and I if we were ready to order, roughly, every three-five minutes--this is something that could be taken as annoying or really good customer service; it didn't bother me too much.  All in all, I would classify this place as a great hangover spot. Very affordable and it helps that it is pretty close to my apartment. I will definitely be coming back to use it as such!

I was so excited to be eating at Sam & George's as the food was tasty, the service was great, and the atmosphere was cozy and warm, perfect for a cold Chicago Sunday. However, a few hours later I was not so happy that I had brunch here as I got very sick to my stomach. Sam & George's fare was the only thing I had eaten so I can only conclude that it was from the omelet I enjoyed. I am pretty sure that everything here is cooked in butter, which makes it all so good! I am giving them 3 stars as it was really tasty food, and it's not their fault my stomach couldn't handle it. I would recommend getting Greek toast with whatever you get, it tends to sop all that butter up!

Its an OK diner the pancakes were good but everything else was average The service was the service staff was very friendly and kind The menu items are overpriced If you're looking for a reasonably priced meal you may not find it here I paid almost 20 dollars for breakfast for one person I ordered one entree orange juice and 1 pancake it was almost $20 Too overpriced for my taste

Nothing spectacular with the food in comparison with the group of people coming in. The skillets serving is worth the money but steak in the skillet is sub-par. The  biscuit and gravy my uncle make a better one. The one they served has an after taste. The eggs Benedict sauce was too lemony. Did not enjoy this dish at all!

Ehhhhhhhh I've been here 4 or 5 times now. It's a short walk from my apartment, and I really wanted to make it my go to breakfast place, but I don't think its going to work out.  While the service isn't anything stellar, it's about what I expect from a diner so I can't really troll them for that.  The food however, has been below average - average every time. The menu is way too big - they need to cut it in half and concentrate on quality.  The skillet was big, greasy and filling but did not achieve any memorable flavors - in fact - I think this is pretty accurate of all the food I've tried from S&G - it lacks flavor.  The Eggs Benedict was swimming in hollandaise sauce and you could just tell it wasn't done right. Everything I've gotten was noticeably off - just not prepared correctly.   Quite frankly, this place serves slop and gets away with it because they've been in business for 50 years.

For whatever reason, I never get here as often as I used to. But S&G always did have great skillets, and decent service for the most part. Too bad it isn't open during late night hours, since I'd pick them over Golden Apple(kitty corner away) anyday. It'd sure be darn nice if I could convince my (difficult to convince) circle of friends to at least put S&G into the rotation every so infrequently, instead of rotating back to some of the meh places they pick like Burgundy. *sigh*

This is a good old school diner type of place. I guess it has been around for a several decades. It sort of looks it, but that is definitely part of its character. in spite of growing up in Chicago, for some reason I never knew about it. I went for brunch. The service was attentive. The food was pretty good. The selection was huge. And we only had to wait a few minutes on a Sunday morning. I would definitely go back.

Everyone in this place was super friendly. Not sure if it was due to the fact I was with regulars or just that they really are that nice. It might be blashphamy, but I almost prefer the place across the street. Walked in about 9 on new years day. Our server Yvonne was absolutely the best!!! Also, being the day after NYE I was shocked to find everyone so damn chipper.  I ordered the greek skillet. It was good, but it was nothing to write home about. I ordered my eggs with the yolk runny and the whites cooked. What I got was runny yolks and whites.  Luckily, the heat from the skillet helped cooked the eggs a bit more. I took only a few bites and took it to go so I could nuke it in the microwave.   Everyone else loved their food and it took it down. I was the only one with a full plate.  The coffee guy is on point. You've barely taken a sip and he's right there to fill up your cup.

I've lived in the lakeview neighborhood for 7 years and just tried S&G this week. It blew away all my expectations. It's a classic greek style diner with e writhing you could ever want! (Waffles, skillets, matzo, Rueben, meatloaf, etc, etc.)
Great service, friendly staff. Food was only so-so. If I lived in the neighborhood I'd come back, but wouldn't make a special trip.
Still the best breakfast place in the city!  Nothing beats their skillets!  Great lunches as well.

I'm not sure what's so amazing about this place. The turkey on the turkey sandwich was the driest, most flavorless I've had. The salad was in a bowl way too small; it was nearly impossible to eat without things falling out of it. The original salad dressing I ordered (garlic) was unbearably sweet, so I asked for ranch instead, which was also way too sugary. The wait service was fine, but George (the man at the register, and owner I'm assuming) was pretty rude to us upon arrival and practically threw a menu at our server after questioning her about the total on our check. Anyway, with Bakin' & Eggs right down the street, I'm not sure why anyone comes here.  Majorly "meh." I won't be back.

Ham ham ham. This place has real ham off the bone. Only place I've found that inbrief city at a great little diner. Counter service if you're in a hurry or by yourself. Old school French toast and chocolate chip pancakes.

Sunday morning we had NO LINE!! Always a plus :)  Food came out Lightening Quick and the portions are misleadingly large if you go with a skillet which is what everyone gets. My skillet of choice was the Godfather but I think the Skirt Steak is better. Coffee is good but you can taste the magic in the freshly squeezed ON (a MUST have).
I love skillets and this is a great place for just that. The food is great the service is great and the place is adorable. Love!

Went to this place with friends who were in town because every other breakfast joint in the area had an hour plus wait. We should have waited...Everything we ordered: eggs, pancakes and waffles with fruit (canned fruit, that is) and an omelette was something we could have made at home that would have tasted way better. The service however, was really good and diners are always a fun place to be but the food here is not worth it.

I loved this place!    We will totally go back!    Took my kids after dance and they treated them like royalty!    The owner (?) George was there and took such good care of us!    The food was classic diner stuff, but had several lo-cal healthy options.

The food was mediocre which is fine about a diner that didn't change his decor from the seventies. While this might be forgettable, the owners behavior is not. Rude, racist and totally unprofessional. We will never return to  this place.

We have been coming here for years!! We used to walk accross the street after school for fries a s a coke. Everyone here is fantastic the owner always asks for family members and hes always so attentive!!! Bring the family here again and again!!!

Very good food. The skillet list was HUGE. That is definitely what we look for when going out to breakfast so that was a nice surprise. However, for two people we payed $50 plus tip for breakfast. A little overpriced, but nice little home-y feel here.

Love S&G for brunch. Best skillets. Had the Tex Mex and it was really tasty. Chili, cheese goodness over hash browns topped with eggs. Obviously not the healthiest of decisions, but it sure did hit the spot!

Went here for brunch Sunday morning after a boat cruise on the river. Service: Service was acceptable, the hostess seemed very agitated and very intense, however, our waitress was very nice.  Atmosphere/decor: we sat outside, which had a nice, but cool, breeze.  I think that would be the best option, as right across the street there is a very beautiful church, and on Sunday mornings there is some hustle and bustle to that church.  Inside, the decor was less appealing.  When I walked to the bathroom it felt cramped, and not the cleanest. Food: If you like eggs on a skillet, then this is the place for you.  Beware though, some of the items can feel a bit, heavy. I've had better egg dishes for brunch though. I think the best selling feature of this restaurant is in its (nearly) unlimited choices. Overall, I probably won't be back, as I wasn't particularly impressed with anything.

This place was hiding in plain sight. I was looking to have breakfast for dinner and this place popped right up in my search. I decided to try it out and I'm glad I did.  They have a GIGANTIC menu with so many options for breakfast as well as several diner style items for lunch and dinner. The waitress was attentive and not pushy at all when I wanted to read all 5 pages full of items before ordering.  I ended up ordering a skillet with chicken tenders and biscuits and gravy.  The skillets come with home fries.  They have an entire page with options for skillets all of which are very hearty.  Lots of greek influence it seemed.   The skillet was actually just ok not out of this world spectacular but i was fine with it.  I also ordered a pecan roll which they cut up and grilled.  It was delicious.  The hostess, maybe owner, was vigilantly watching the door and very pleasant at check out time.  We chatted a bit about the pies that are in a case by the door.  I asked if they were made in house but she said "no but don't ask me where we get them."  I didn't probe because I didn't now if she meant she couldn't remember or she wasn't willing to share their pie provider!  I will be back next time I'm in the mood for breakfast for dinner.

Good place for breakfast. The orange juice is fresh and full of pulp, which I love. And they have many option for skillet. Served in a iron pan with hash brown and other stuff of choice. Very tasty. Good service.

The food is incredible. I've been there a few times and would go even more, if the manager with the mustache wasn't there. Two out of the three times I've been, he was working and both times was the rudest person in customer service I've ever experienced. From asking me if I know how to read, to me initiating a greeting as I walk in the door, only for him to roll his eyes and answer me with, "It's terrible. What? You expect me to stand here and lie and tell you it's good?" Then proceeds to yell at the staff for them to do their job. Once, I went in looking for my keys that dropped and the older man (no mustache) greeted me and was the absolute sweetest. And the wait staff has always been friendly as well.  I'd give this place 5 stars if it weren't for that one man who is clearly in the wrong industry and definitely in the wrong position. Serving is not your strong suit, sir. Maybe some place away from people would better serve everyone.

More like a 3.5.  This is my Saturday brunch experience.   Ambience: You can tell this is an old timer family owned establishment. No A/c inside but I saw tons of fans blowing. I sat on the porch myself which was lovely. Dog friendly! :) Service: Friendly host with NO wait (does that even exist on a Saturday morning?) for outdoor seating. Score! The waitress was also very attentive. Food: For their, brunch, skillets are king. I got the chicken fried steak skillet which was yummy. The biscuit that accompanied it could have been flakier and the white gravy would have been creamier, but I have to keep telling myself I'm not in the south. Overall: Great neighborhood brunch spot that I would recommend for a quick meal with (at least in my experience) little to no wait on a weekend summer day.

Absolutely no complaints! BYOB, outdoor searing, superb food, parking not an issue, prices are pretty good and great customer service. I was in a group of 3, and we all were satisfied. Exceeded expectations!! A+++

So let me set the scene. I live in the neighborhood and have walked by this place a thousand times. I've always assumed that it would be a crappy diner best saved for those seeking an average bite given the number of brunch spots nearby (i.e. why would I go to S&G when I could go to the likes of Batter & Berries or Bakin N Eggs).  On a Sunday which happened to be my girlfriend's birthday, she suggested we check out S&G and the look I gave her was no doubt incredulous (yes, I can be a brunch snob). Nevertheless, I hardened up and prepared for the disappointment that was to come...my girlfriend amused at my discomfort and my stomach readying itself for the impending disaster. Before I continue, I should preface by saying I have no problem with eating at diners. I had anticipated going somewhere a little "nice", however, given the state of our hangovers, my girlfriend made an executive decision not to wait in line at some of the nearby establishments. We arrived at S&G and were promptly greeted by a friendly middle aged waitress who asked us to take a sit wherever we liked. Not having to wait was refreshing and I looked around with unease at my surroundings as we took up seats at one of the booths. Family photographs and 50's decor splattered the diner. Jeez this place had been around for a while.  Another friendly staff member took our drink order, a couple orange juices, which arrived promptly. They were fresh and refreshing, my brain notifying me that this was likely to be the highlight. As we looked through the expansive menu, I couldn't help but overhear the owner, or who I'm assuming to be the owner, having conversations with groups of customers who were no doubt regulars. He came over and asked how we were doing and I gave him a nervous smile. Moments later the friendly waitress that sat us took our order, we both ordered breakfast skillets (I had the greek style gyros skillet and my girlfriend ordered one with steak). While we were waiting I couldn't help but feel the friendly family vibe within the establishment. A cute older greek woman manning the cashier, the owner with his thick accent (sounded New York), regularly checking up on customers and thanking his staff for picking up the slack. A 90's Richard Gere flick, First Knight playing on the sole television by the entrance and another woman paying close attention to customer coffees which needed a top up.  Our enormous skillets arrived, the gyro chunks didn't look great....but as I took my first bite of the eggs/hash/gyro/tzatziki combination my taste buds fucking exploded. WTF!! JESUS FUCKING CHRIST!! THIS IS FUCKING DELICIOUS!!  The next 10 minutes were very special, I gave that skillet the attention it deserved, I devoured it with the sexual aggression a cougar has towards her prey. I did look up now and then to acknowledge the comparatively insignificant conversation my girlfriend was attempting, while at the same time trying some of her delicious steak. I left S&G with a grin on my face.

This is a must for breakfast everytime I'm in town. Wayne's star spangled skillet is awesome. The owners are huge characters that really help define the place and make it a good time. Can't recommend this place enough.

First things first, came here due to the fact they had biscuits and gravy and where the closest place that severed biscuits and gravy. With that being said I was surprised with this place. It was packed on this Sunday morning and me and my group of 7 only had to wait for about 10 minutes but I suggest standing outside because they have no waiting space inside. I had the country skillet which has their sausage gravy on it and I'll admit that is was nothing special with food but the price was right for the amount of food you get, maybe a bit more food then what you pay for but that's just more bang for your buck! The service was great and I got to meet George who was working the front of the shop and is a great pick me up and a funny guy to talk to after being out late the night before. I would not go out of my way to eat here but if I was in the neighborhood this would be the place to go for good food, great service, and a friendly staff.

So was one of my go to week day lunch spots. I love dinners not because the food is great but the cross section of people who work and eat there. Dinners allow interaction between the hipster and the yuppie and the truck driver and the young married couple with a baby. But what happens when you turn the restaurant tv to Fox News. Hate speech comes flying and I feel assaulted. When I asked the father to change the station he said he liked it and would not. Well I guess the customer doesn't matter. I cannot give my $ to a business the purposefully chooses to be that biased publically. I cancelled my order told his daughter who is very sweet why I was leaving. Please if you go ask them to change the station. The food has also taken a dive since the old man came back, more frozen Cisco.

I love S&G so much I wrote an essay about it in the sixth grade...and won the contest. It is a no frills, family-owned diner. John and Fran have celebrated all my childhood milestones (graduations, driver's license) and continue to provide the most delicious skillets and french toast. Here's the skinny: skillets are great to share or perfect to devour when you've boozed too much (I love the Porky's Cousin, no mushrooms). Get the Greek toast, don't waste your time with wheat bread. If you're looking for a non-breakfast dish, you really can't go wrong with a BLT and a shake (they give you the extra shake in the metal container, thank gawd!).  If you're looking for a fancy brunch, exit to the left and head south to Bucktown. For those that want a delicious breakfast, excellent service, and a Dum Dum on your way out, go see John and Frannie.

This is a cozy, family-run diner. Try one of their egg skillets. The LaBamba and Athenian are delicious! This place is also not likely to have a long wait (or any wait at all) even on Saturday morning when everyone is out brunching.
This place is great! The food is amazing and the staff enjoys working for the owners. Weekends the place is packed with laughter and great food! This is a place you need to try.
We ate bfast here. Yum! We had French toast and a pesidente skillet. Both where good. If you want a good hearty bfast this is the place. The staff treat you like family! Everyone is so friendly!!

Nothing better than finding a brunch spot that is busy but not overly packed (or have a long wait). Large diner-esque menu with the real gem being their 27 or so skillets. Had the Porky's Cousin (2 eggs, bacon, onions and mushrooms over hashbrowns) and really enjoyed it. Very tasty and filling and not at all greasy. Recommended.

We ended up here because there was a 90-minute line at Batter and Berries down the street, and our friends noticed it had four stars on Yelp and were willing to give it a try.  I think they were disappointed: This is a diner, not a foodie paradise, and instead of sweet potato waffle with boutique fried chicken, they serve french toast and breakfast skillets.  The most creative they get is that the skillets come with things like chorizo and salsa and you can get french toast made out of raisin bread. But you know what?  The service was unfussy, fast, and accommodating.  They let us move to an outside table even after we'd gotten coffee and water inside, they came by frequently to refresh coffee and water, and they were very friendly.  Most importantly, this is the kind of place that you can walk in and be seated immediately for brunch at 11:25 a.m. on a summer Sunday morning in Lincoln Park.  For all of that, I think they're worth four stars after all. Sometimes the best brunch is the one you can have without waiting in line for hours.

This was my second time having brunch at Sam & George's. Do it. The food is delicious, creative (omelet with lox and onions = yum!), amply portioned, and quickly delivered. The staff is exceptionally friendly and attentive. Shaded outdoor seating puts it over the top. Five stars all the way.

Was visiting Chicago and recommended to my life-long Lincoln Park resident girlfriend that we try Sam & George's. Initially she was skeptical since if she wasn't aware of it, how could it be good (typical North Side attitude)? When she realized she could bring her dog and we could eat outdoors, she warmed-up to my suggestion. Well we ordered breakfast skillets and they were fantastic! very tasty and quite filling too. Our waitress couldn't be nicer and more patient because we took our time ordering and had lots of questions. Several staff members came by during our meal and they were all very friendly and genuinely glad we stopped by. In the end, she sheepishly admitted I was right and vowed to return. Feels sooo good to beat the locals!
The pancakes tasted like bisquick, which was very disappointing. Your average greasy American breakfast. Service was good though!

Stopped by Sam and George's today, and was *terribly* unimpressed.  The advertisements on the wall convinced me to get iced coffee instead of hot. Sadly, my iced coffee was served to me in a dirty glass. You could still see the lip prints from the last customer who used it. When they replaced it, they filled it so full of coffee and ice that it was impossible to take a sip without spilling it. They left absolutely no room for sugar or cream, despite the advertisements being of coffee with cream in it. I personally hate the taste of plain coffee, but I had to drink several gulps to be able to fit in any cream or sugar. My husband ordered the country fried steak & eggs with a side of corned beef hash.
