He only ordered the corned beef hash because we were assured that it was made fresh and that it did not come out of a can. It most certainly was *not* freshly made. It was a plate full of salty mush. His sunny-side up eggs were so under-cooked that when he put them on top of the hash, I couldn't help but remark about how gross it was that there was so much runny, uncooked egg white and that I would be afraid to eat it. There was so much of it that he was able to remove 2 gooey forkfuls. As for my breakfast, based on the suggestion of our waitress, I ordered a chicken finger skillet with gravy. It was passable. As other reviewers have mentioned, the skillets are humongous. I couldn't even finish half of it, and I am not a small lady. I don't think I'd order it again unless I was out drinking late and had someone to share it with. Lastly, they offered my husband multiple refills on his hot coffee, but never once offered me a refill on my iced coffee, so I drank a lot of water. The only reason that I'm giving 2 stars and not one is that our waitress was sweet and funny.  For ~$40 for 2 people to eat after tax and tip, you can do a whole lot better.

Typical Mediocre Breakfast spot.  I got the Country Fried Steak and Biscuits, it was underwhelming. Biscuits were stale, eggs were way under-cooked, and gravy was bland. For what they charged I was disappointed. The waitress was nice, which is why this a two star review and not a one.
This is the quintessential breakfast joint in Chicago. Try any of their skillets. Great French toast also. You will not be disappointed.

This classic diner hits the spot when you're looking for a classic "All American" breakfast. I've been here several times and always end up with breakfast. The atmosphere is nothing fancy, exactly what you would expect from an old school diner. In a strange way it's actually kind of refreshing to visit a place like this.

The breakfast skillets are fantastic! It is somewhat of a hole in the wall but the staff are all friendly and helpful, walking a friend through the whole rather large menu on what she wanted to eat. I have only had breakfast here but I have had friends try other items and they like it. Everything seems pretty homemade, definitely try the skillets!

Bad customer service. . We called at 2 before coming for sunday brunch and were told that its open till 4pm. We reach there at 2 :45 pm and the door is locked. When we called them again and they said we closed as it wasnt busy.. Really? They could have said that before when we called that they might close early because they aren't that busy and we would've been absolutely fine.. and just as we were leaving we saw another family disappointed seeing the door locked.. might have good food but need better customer service and communication...

I've been here over 20 times the past 6 years and each time the food has always been delicious and consistent. Perfect location, perfect food, perfect price, the service is amazing, and the owners are there to ensure that every customer is enjoying their experience.  You will never leave unhappy!

Decent enough.  Nothing fancy.  Feel I could have made our breakfast at home.  We found it while meaning to go to batter and berries but couldn't handle the wait and saw this place on yelp.  So maybe I was expecting the complicated nature of their amazing food and got this instead.  Lots of options.  Great service.  I think it's perfect for someone who doesn't have a complex palate or maybe picky even.
Service was good. Skillets creative and solid but nothing incredible. Certainly enjoyed my visit there for brunch.

This is my favorite local brunch restaurant! John and Fran are the best--they always make sure we have a table and are taken care of! My fiance and I love thier honey mustard and they always let us take some extra home. I love supporting this local restaurant!
The staff is very attentive, friendly and humorous.  Food wasn't bad- almost too many options to choose from.

The food that you eat gives you energy to do your everyday routines. And ofcourse, you must also eat healthy food for you to be healthy. So its a big deal for me if what place and where I would to eat, what if they are not clean enough when ate there? I arrived here last day around 7AM and what I love on Sam & George's is, they open very early. So its very convenient for me because I had a early job in the morning. The Country fried steak skillet w/ hashbrowns was superB, didnt ate that delicious looking and delicious tasting breakfast ever. One of the places that has delicious food and checked so far. You'll gonna love it here.!
This place is an excellent brunch spot! Make sure you take into consideration when church is ending because this place can get very crowded! Family owned business! Nice and homey.

My husband and I came here to try their famous skillets.  I had the 'Porky Pig' which was a skillet full of hash browns, sauteed onions, mushrooms, sliced sausage links, melted cheddar cheese, and two eggs (any style) on top.  It was a generous portion - the skillet was very generous in portion and came out hot hot hot.  The food was very simple and very straightforward - shredded hash browns, I liked the sauteed onions and the sliced mushrooms; the sausages were good, and I liked the abundance of the melted cheese on top.  Adding ketchup and hot sauce gives it an extra kick.  The staff is friendly, and the place itself is very busy; very cute place! +'Porky Pig' skillet +friendly staff

Skillet was average but my coffee had a piece of napkin in it. First my waitress insisted that it was sugar, which i never added... Then after i scooped out the piece of napkin to prove my sanity, she goes, "oh, well. I will just get you a new one." No apology or anything. That sums up the shitty overall customer service.

I only write reviews for places I love and would recommend. Writing a bad review isn't my style- I just wouldn't return to a place I had a bad experience with.  My fiancé and I went here on New Year's Day, and it was packed, but we got seated right away. It was our first visit and wow we're we impressed. It's a family run establishment and the owner walks around greeting everyone, the hostess who most were calling "mom" had the best energy and not only was seating people but re-filling coffees and waters at tables. The service was absolutely excellent!!! Now to the food....the skillets...tons to choose from and...oh....my...gosh....we're they amazing. We were certainly in a food coma after but totally worth it and very satisfied. Since NYD we have been back 3 times....new favorite breakfast spot- consistently delicious and exceedingly friendly service-thank you!

Cute little mom & pop joint. The chef (and I'm assuming owner) was very friendly. The food was pretty good, but the service was just alright. I felt rushed by our server consistently throughout the meal. She kept asking if we were ready yet and gave us our check about five minutes after we got our food. The booths were also strangely small/close together, which was kind of awkward. As for what we ordered, we got a banana waffle and a scramble. Both were tasty, better than say an IHOP/Denny's, but not the best breakfast I've ever had in my life. Overall, an alright experience, but I won't be going out of my way to come back.

We always like this restaurant for quick service and good food.  Funny to see how many people come here for hangovers.  We come because it is consistently good food and always a fun place.  Good folks!  John, ya gotta do something about that coffee.   It's weak.

This place is the epitome of a good diner. I had the older gentleman calling me "honey" and wondering whether or not I can eat all my food.  I got the huevos rancheros to nurse my hangover and was pleasantly surprised! The inexpensive and delicious meal was fantastic. The service was so fast.  My only complaint is the booth I was in. Two people seated, but it was really a booth for one. There were two small ladies, and we couldn't both fit.

DO NOT ORDER THE BREAKFAST BURRITO. I should have known better, S & G is an adorable family-owner American diner. You order the eggs, or waffles, or hash browns. The atmosphere is classic inviting Midwestern, the staff is friendly without being too pushy. It's just a great place for a cup of coffee and some pie.  Why did I think the breakfast burrito was the way to go? Well, don't do it, it was tasty for about 3 bites before I really realized it was just a two-inch diameter log of soft chorizo with some egg thoroughly blended in. Then I kept eating because I'm not terribly bright. Most human digestive tracts are not designed to handle that much pork fat, and 36 hours later unspeakable, chorizo colored things happened. I really enjoyed my time at this diner, but next time I'm getting a skillet.

I love love love this place! I would come here with my roommates literally every weekend when we lived in Lakeview. The owners are fabulous and always treated us warmly! Great food and great atmosphere!

What a nice Chicago Diner!  Full of locals, and die hard Chicagoans, you won't find too many snobs or pretentious fools in this place.  This place is full of repeat customers who live in the area, and it will probably remind you of a place your grandfather would take you, and I mean that in a good way...  Though not completely unique, their food is good, and very reasonably priced.   If breakfast skillets is your thing, they have a ton of options, and each one has a funny or unique name, a "Dudley Do-right" anyone?     Overall, the staff is always great, and attentive...  The coffee is pretty basic but not terrible, so don't let that discourage you.

This place has pretty good food, especially the skillets. However, the owner is a jerk. I've seen him yelling at his staff right in front of his customers. I also called to place a pick up order and he hung up on me. Would go there more if it weren't for him. Total asshole
Favorite breakfast/diner in Chicago!! I am obsessed this is perfection.

My favorite breakfast place in the city. The skillets are amazing, the staff is super friendly and make you feel like family.  Order any of their 30 skillets options or go with the biscuits and gravy! I have only been here for breakfast, but they serve it all day, so it's always an option :)

Sam and George's is as good as it gets in the area for an awesome diner brunch meal, whether you are hungover or not. I've been here maybe 10 times in the last few months, and the food has never once disappointed me. I highly recommend the avocado skillet and/or the Godfather skillet, which I have had multiple times. Delicious! They do the little things right here, like never leaving you hanging to refill your coffee as many times as you need it.   Lastly, in the summer Sam and George's is a great place to come with your dog if you have one!  You can sit out on the patio and they'll bring you a pan of water for your canine.   I've tried out quite a few brunch places in the area but S&G's is hands down my favorite when you consider ambiance, price, food quality and service. I keep forcing myself to try out other places but I find that I keep coming back to Sam and George's! A+!

Great mom and pop environment. The food was blah. Ordered the skillet ... Had no flavor and was undercooked.   Ordered a side of biscuit. It was chewy! Clearly had been out in a microwave or something.  I returned it and they were very sweet about replacing my side.  Coffee is like tea. Tasteless and very weak.  Great service. Everyone was so nice.  However food wise. It's very average and nothing to rave about.

Took my daughter to breakfast here on one of the many CPS days off of school; we both got panckaes, and bacon, and they treated us extremely well, were very attentive and sweet to my daughter. Just a solid place with good people and an owner who seems to care a great deal about his patrons.

I've been to S&G so often over the years that I guess I've overlooked it, time to correct it!  S&G is the epitome of your neighborhood diner, in the best way possible. I love coming here because you never have to wait for a table and the service and the food are always great.  The menu is positively giant but I always find myself coming back to their egg casseroles (otherwise known as skillets) and I'd have to say that Porky's Cousin may be the best hangover cure I've ever found outside of a McDonald's. It's a ton of food that is always perfectly prepared and you never have to wait too long. Need I say more?  Maybe I'll come back one day and try something other than an egg casserole but I somehow doubt that. Try S&G, you will love, love, love it.

This was the first place I went to for breakfast when I moved to the area this summer. One woman (maybe the manager) introduced herself to my friends and me and always recognizes us. Food is good diner food, especially the French toast, just don't expect gourmet brunch. It's cheap and quick. Again, it's good diner food.

I wish I could give Sam and George's zero stars. I have never been treated so poorly at a restaraunt in my life. The owner of this place is the rudest individual. My girlfriends and I ate here for breakfast last Saturday and when we went to pay, he asked us what we wanted like we were disturbing him. Um sir, we are here to pay YOU. Then when trying to scramble to pay, he told us he did not have time for this and that one of us needed to pony up for the $50 tab. He rushed one of us into paying on a card and after we comented on how rude he was being he told us he will chalk this up as a terrible experience for the two of us. We were a group of 5 women and two children. Never in my life have I been spoken to like this...we are upset we even paid the man. He made such a scene it was unreal. Never visit this place, the food was not worth it.

After reading other Yelp reviews, I had high hopes for this place. It was just OK, in my opinion. The wait staff was courteous and the owner(?) at the cash register was super sweet, but the food wasn't what I expected. The split pea soup was pretty good, but I didn't care for the croutons that came with it. They were greasy and didn't really do much to complement the flavor of the soup. I also ordered the chicken Philly which was a real disappointment. The chicken was rubbery and didn't have much flavor, the melted cheese had the same consistency as the chicken, and even the grilled onions and mushrooms lacked flavor. The French bread was OK, but I didn't really care since the rest of the sandwich was so bland. I got a side of tater tots, which I guess was the best part of the meal.  Normally I would give a place like this 2 stars instead of 3, but I'll give it another try someday and order something else. It's really the kind of place I want to love, so I don't mind going again to see if it's better.

My group came from St. Louis and specifically wanted to eat at S&G's restaurant because of the name. Sam is the name of my 6 year old cousin who recently lost his grandpa George. He misses him a lot so we thought this would be a great place to take him. We walked in and asked if they sold t-shirts in kids sizes and they went above and beyond to find one. While we were eating they threw Sam his shirt. And there was no charge despite offering. You just don't see that much these days. Great people... Now onto the food...it was AMAZING. The toast and english muffins are addictive. Their omelet was the perfect balance of cheese, meat and egg. The mickey mouse pancake face is a hit with the kids. This is one of those hidden gems that make the drive to Chicago worthwhile. Thanks again to the owners...like I said...they need more business owners like them! Much love from St. Louis!

I've lived about a block away from this place for about four years, and at one point I was going there twice a week for breakfast.  I really like the food, but I don't think I want to go there anymore.  There's only so many times you can watch the owner(the guy, not the woman, who is really nice) berate his employees from across the room.  He really does yell across the diner in front of dozens of people about perceived mistakes.  It's kind of weird to just sit there at eat while its going on. Worth it, if you don't mind watching employee drama

Short answer: food is good, service is just okay.  If you're a regular, it seems, they're all over you.  If you haven't been there enough to be a regular (read: once), service isn't nearly as good. I went there for lunch today.  Beautiful day, wanted to sit outside. The sign outside said go inside to get seated out there.  So I did that.  The cashier (an older man, maybe an owner?) was chatting with the two customers at the register. I'm guessing that more than a minute passed before finally a woman came out (maybe another owner -- not dressed like waitstaff, probably my age) and said I could choose a table out there.  There were two occupied tables outside and I didn't see anyone seated inside unless they were in the back.  Still, it took a little while to get service.  Owner lady was leaving with her daughter and mentioned that my waitress was on her way. She seemed like the only one for whom customer service was a concern. Once the waitress did take my drink order, it was quick with both a carafe of water and tea from her and the busboy.  I had several minutes to peruse the lengthy menu and made my choice.  *twiddling thumbs...actually, looking a phone* Menu closed.  The other waitress asked if my waitress had been by.  Yes, to get my drink order. So she finally comes out and takes my order.  Asked if I wanted toast with my skillet. Yes, please. She also took the time to chat with table next to me -- clearly regulars based on their conversation.  Order comes out pretty quickly minus the toast.  The Gypsy Skillet was good and it was hot.  Didn't exactly miss the toast but did order it. Again it took a while before the waitress came back with the check.  She asked if I wanted a to go box.  Yes, please. She then went to the new table seated on the patio and chatted with those gentlemen for several minutes. Wonder if she has short term memory issues --- no toast, no box for the to go.  The busboy came by to ask if I was done. I told him that I wanted the to go box that he brought quickly.   When I went inside to pay, there were 4 tables occupied so busier than before. Still, there were at least two waitresses and not that many tables. The owner man wasn't rude but not exactly friendly.   I'll probably return at some point because the skillet was so darn good but as close as I live to the restaurant, I don't see myself becoming a regular.

i went here for a Saturday brunch and had such a lovely experience!  A friend joined me and we were able to not only BYOB (lovely bottle of moscato) but sit outside with our dogs!  The service was so friendly and even offered us a bowl of water for the pups.  The food was amazing, but be careful their skillets are large enough to share (but we each ate our whole skillet as it was so yummy!).  Overall a great local diner and an incredible experiece :)

I came to S&Gs for a patio brunch with my girlfriend and our DOGS. Neither of us had been before, but BOTH of us will be back :)  The staff was very friendly, and we were seated promptly on the patio.  We brought our own bottle of wine and were provided with glasses.  We also got a pitcher of water for continued hydration. Yippee.  Our fur-children were received warmly, and were not the only ones. Now for the food. We got 2 skillets and shared both. Variety is the spice of life! Kevin L's Special skillet, with gyros and feta and jalapenos, because my friend was craving spicy. Amaaaazing. La Bamba skillet, with chorizo and cheese and 2 eggs on top. Again, AMAZING. Both skillets were very flavorful. It's very possible to ruin a skillet by putting too much faith in the potato, but S&G goes big with the flavor.  I'm not sure if we were just enjoying ourselves so much surrounded by the flower boxes, sitting right next to the lovely St Alfonsus church, or if the food really did come out that quickly, but we were starving and happy that the food seemed to arrive very quickly.  The price is also fantastic considering how full you'll be when you finish that skillet.  I loved this place and I will go back. It was worth the 30 minute trek to Lakeview.

Aside from having a huge menu with delicious food, you can't beat the hospitality at this place! Any restaurant with a staff that goes above and beyond and gives a little girl a shawl because she's cold, a little pouting boy some cars to make him smile, or a personal escort for an elderly handicapped man in a wheelchair from his car to his table is one that deserves more than just 5 stars!! These 3 incidences happened all in the 1 hour my husband and I enjoyed our breakfast last Saturday. It was so refreshing to see how much they care about making their customers happy.  We have lived in Lakeview and have been going to this restaurant now for about 8 years. We have brought many friends and family members here as well. This is by far the best breakfast place in Chicago, not only because of the delicious food but because the service here is genuine and unbeatable. Its your typical family owned restaurant where everyone cares about your experience and hopes that you walk out full and satisfied.  I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone I know. My husband and I will continue to enjoy this amazing neighborhood, family restaurant for as long as we live in the city :)  Go Check it out!! I assure you, you won't be disappointed!!
Good food, good hospitality.

this is the diners of diners. most diners are just about the exact same yet this place is on another level. i go with the egg casserole (skillet) just about every time. they are always delicious and i've yet had a complaint on the main course (breakfast/brunch). now where S&G separates themselves from all other dinners are the small things. first their toast, it sure as balls isn't wonder bread, but much more of a tasty bakers bread. while the bread is good, their english muffins are on a completely different level. they are the airiest tastiest english muffins that i have even tasted (my girlfriend wants to ask who their vendor is every time since she's in catering, but i won't allow us to be "those people", but i kind of want to know my self too). also, for the longest time they only used the "fancy" jam, which has seeds and great flavor--though the marmalade never has good flavor--but on our last visit there was some smuckers mixed in with the good stuff. not a big enough deal, this place is still the absolute best diner around!!

My first time I went for lunch so I could sit outside, love the outdoor seating they have. The service really was the worst part. My ham and swiss sandwich was good, the croissant it was on was great, I really wanted mayo but never saw my server again to ask her for it. They had a large menu and some good reviews but I don't think I will be returning.

I have lived in the area for over a year but have never gone in. Finally when my dad and brother were in town we stopped in for breakfast! They have awesome breakfast. It was cheap, good, and fast. My dad was not a fan of the BBQ chicken sandwich he got... but they are known for breakfast and not BBQ sandwiches' ! This will definitely become a tradition for me!

Go there!! There are so many reasons why this is the best breakfast place. The casseroles kill it and the Fage yogurt, berries and granola plate is absolutely gorgeous. The manager came around twice to personally ask us how we were doing - love that. He is one of the reasons my cousin (visiting from St. Louis) and I (from SF) are now obsessed with Chicago! There's an outdoor seating area, and it is just up the street from Atlas brewery. This is the nicest establishment I've been to in a long time - the service is phenomenal.

S & G is a bit of a greasy spoon, but it's not dirty.   Just about everything on the menu is served with what seems like 2 potatoes-worth of shredded hash browns, but it's not too bad.   The egg skillets are the way to go.   Nothing fancy, just good ol' greasy American breakfast on the cheap.

Service is a bit slow, but wow it is worth the wait. I am a hash brown junkie, and this place DELIVERS.  Shredded potato goodness and lots of it.   The chicken fried steak is also pretty tasty and clearly freshly breaded, not frozen prepackaged crap.  For a twist, instead of plain gravy, it is served with sausage gravy (mmm...pig on pig).   My friend advertised it as a greasy spoon, and while the food definitely looks and tastes like diner food (yes, that's a compliment), the restaurant is clean and well managed.

I cannot RAVE about this place enough. Truly a gem that I hope never ever closes. The morning we went it was SUPER busy (as we were warned) but, by some stroke of luck, we got a spot at the counter. And that's where you want to sit. That's where all the action is, where the regulars sit, and where you get to interact with the owner, someone who could easily have been Rhoda Morgenstern's Greek auntie. What a treat it was to be on the front line. Despite the absolute mayhem that is Sunday Morning Brunch in Chicago, it was still a delight. The food came out on time and delicious, hot. Our coffees were never empty more than 3.2 minutes. It was, overall, a treat. I don't rave too many times, but this one deserves much.

YUM YUM YUM.  This is my go-to breakfast spot. S&Gs knows how to handle a crowd on weekends and though it is always hoppin', I never have to wait for a table, which is awesome considering the 30+ waits breakfast places in this area typically have. The food is no fuss too, hearty breakfasts without the inflated prices and unnecessary fru fru offered by many other brunch spots. The skillets are amazing -- and certainly converted this former hashbrown/eggs hater. Great food, excellent service, all at a reasonable price. It really can't be beat.

Yelp milestone: review #300!  Usually I trust the reviews and order the menu item that everyone says to order. I went in with the plan to order the skillet, and goshdarnit - I shoulda stuck with it. I saw a corned beef omelet on the menu and it reminded me of this creation that I had in Vegas with a giant thing of corned beef smothered in swiss cheese with eggs on the side. It was by far the most earth shattering breakfast I ever consumed and actually was far too rich to consume something like that upon waking up from a hangover, but come on, it's Vegas! I got that vision in my head and wanted to re-live it all over again. Sadly, this was nothing like that. When I walked in, I was convinced that I wasn't in the right restaurant. For such a successful restaurant, I would think they would have remodeled at least once since the 70's but I guess they want to stick with the original charm. The owner was a bit brusk with us due to the fact it was so overwhelmingly busy, but he wasn't brusk in a mean way - just in a hurried way. We were seated and immediately poured a couple glasses of water, while we looked over the menu. It took a few minutes for the waitress to come over to us, but we were both able to decide what we wanted. My mom opted for the eggs benedict and I went with the freshly squeezed OJ, Greek toast (upon Yelp recommendations) and the corned beef and swiss omelet. Our food was out rather quickly, so we were pleasantly surprised.  The OJ was fabulous in the way that the freshly squeezed sort always is, albeit a little sweet. I devoured it rather quickly and found myself wishing I would have savored it. The greek toast was also really good. I normally find myself not eating the bread, but I ate all of theirs. I liked the hashbrowns a lot, as they were half crispy and half soft. My mother on the otherhand hated them as she prefers hers "extra crispy." The omelet was way overcooked and almost that rubbery texture that eggs can get. While corned beef normally adds an over-saltyness that I'm quite fond of, this variety didn't add much salt to it. Supposedly there was swiss on it, but I couldn't taste any. For our breakfasts, it was only $23 plus tip. I thought this was a great value for two huge breakfasts that filled me up till dinner. Next time I will return and get one of those skillets. The people next to us ordered them and they looked wonderful!

You can call this my little diner obssession! Its the best of the best anywhere! S&G is my go to when ppl come to visit.  The best part, aside from the egg casserole, is that they serve breakfast ALL DAY! The girl there that serve are awesoem and always more then friendly.  To see them in real action, go on a Saturday or Sunday mroning before 1ish and you'll feel like you're in a food network show!  They are the heart and soul of this place and always a pleasure!  There's also always plenty of parking at this gem for you other car drivers!   Back to the egg casseroles, I thought ppl who came here and ordered anything elses were crazy, but my mom and dad came with me on their recent visit and they ordered bluberry pancakes and a ruben and guess what folks? always super good!  Don't think you can leave here without a tummy that is stuffed, they give you plenty of food!  I even ask the girls not to bring me the sides of toast bc I can never finish my casserole much less toast. Make sure to try and bring cash for the tip, I usually leave a 5 at home when we go out bc I  know I'll need it first thign for S&G breakfast!!  And don't worry about running out of your much needed coffee ot diet coke, they keep it coming!  I'm so obssessed with this place, you would think I'm there regional sales manager...I literally have business cards in my purse! My advice to order: The Gypsy add jalopenos :) They're biscuits and gravy are also amazing, and that's cmoing from a true southerner so you know they're legit! MUST GO!!!!

Not my favorite. Cons: I saw the waitress touching the strawberries to spread them out onto my toast. Not very enjoyable either way though. It was edible... but maybe that way bc I was starving.  Pros: The orange juice was fresh squeezed and delicious. Also the owner was adorable.  Bottom line: would I come back? No.

By far a neighborhood diner... It's a cozy, comfy little diner with a heck of a menu.  Had the S&G burger and was amazed.  They seem to make everything and you can tell the difference. I loved it and definitely will be going back soon.    The owner, "i think",  was hilarious was very loud(she's Greek-Francis).  She was cracking jokes with the staff and the customers, which she knew personally.  She took the time to ask us how everything was and chatted with us for a bit.  Nice to know that business owners still value customers feedback and your business is appreciated.  Outside-it doesn't look very inviting but it's got alot of character inside.  Definitely worth going in to eat-you won't be disappointed.

We came here as a group of 7 on Sunday morning and - amazingly - were able to be seated immediately. And it was exactly what you would expect out of a typical diner - huge selection on the menu, bottomless coffee and bustling, great service. We'll definitely be back for more skillets!

Went here on a busy Saturday morning for brunch. The wait wasn't too long and the service was pretty fast and the employees were pleasant. What sucked was the food. The coffee was weak, the skillet I had lacked flavor and had no seasoning and the pancakes were dry and flavorless. $35 for two breakfasts and I've had cafeteria food that was better. Golden Apple down the street is better and I'm not even a big fan of Golden Apple. The service was good, so two stars for the service.

I have eaten breakfast, lunch and dinner at S&G and every meal has been fantastic.  The food is good and plentiful and the staff is great.  Not only do they know how to get the food on the table, but they are friendly and usually keep the drinks full.  It is definitely more enjoyable to eat at a restaurant where the staff works hard to ensure that you get a great meal quickly than where the staff thinks that they are doing you a favor by allowing you to eat.  The restaurant is not fancy, but I would take good food and service over decor any day of the week.
This place is where breakfast dreams come true. Huge skillets, good coffee, and unique service. It's exactly what I think of when I think of a diner. I'm super full.

From the outside, it does not look to be best appetizing place. Once you walk in, sit down and get served your meal you will be in "awe." I absolutely love the service---they are constantly coming back to fill the water and coffee. It seemed like that they have 10 min intervals where they would come back around and make sure every customer was happy.  Now let's talk about the food! I got the "Panhandler" and it was an awesome skillet. It had so much flavor and it was so filling. Bite after bite, I was so pleased with how great the whole meal was complimented with the toast. .  There really wasn't any line and I really liked the atmosphere inside. It had that nice "diner" appeal and it brought back memories of being back home in central Wisconsin and it felt like it'd be a great place to stop in at while partaking in a road trip...
Plenty of great breakfast options, hardly ever a wait and friendly, efficient service.  No, it's not a hip Southport Ave brunch spot - but that's also one of the best things about it!
Sitting in S&G and having lunch, eating one of the best Greek Salads ever.  One of the daily specials. Service is top notch as always. THIS is one of my favorite restaurants!
This is one of my favorite little spots to eat. Fast service, everyone is nice, and the egg casseroles are delicious. They give you a ton of food and make everything fresh!

This place is great. It's very busy on Sunday mornings but it's worth a bit of a wait. I went after a bike ride and was ready to indulge. It was a glorious day in the summer so I chose a seat outside. The experience was exactly what I wanted. The staff was "diner sweet" as like to say. They came buy to refill my coffee (which was adequate) frequently and my water. I order one of the egg casseroles which come loaded with food on these massive skillets. What's great is they come out fast. VERY fast. Even better it's delicious. A huge amount of lovely comforting food. I can't say enough how great the staff is and how fun a place this is.
Great selection and quick service. We're had the skillets before and they never disappoint - just be sure you bring cash to tip your server, they don't like when you try to include it on your card.

I was wandering around the area looking for a bite to eat waiting to meet a friend later that night. Found Sam & George's and instantly I felt as accomplished as Lewis & Clarke did when they saw the Pacific. I guess I'm saying great find, Tom! So it's a bit of hole in the wall place but it's still clean and inviting to be in there.  Typical breakfast-y place when you first read the menu but honestly so many places cant get it right, not the case here! I had one of their Egg Casseroles - or us none regulars would call it a skillet. It was pretty awesome to point where I declared the best breakfast I've had... even though I was having it for dinner. My gal had banana pancakes which were pretty rock solid as well!  The other thing I thought was real awesome was they had Barry's Irish Tea. Kind of a random place to find that but I was really happy having tea from my homeland.  The service was great and I'm going to get out there more regularly! This is a must go!

Extremely family friendly with consistent food and service. We've been going for breakfast for years and despite all of the other spots in Chicago, we always go back. They treat everyone well and make things right. We love them!

Eh...nothing that great. I've eaten here at least 5 times and I always feel the same about it...eh. Personally I think it's a tad over priced for the food that it is. It's basic finer fare that runs 2 bucks over what it should. My go to at diners - a Reuben - is $10.50 here. 2 bucks too much, right?! The real reason why I will never go back here is because of the woman at the till. She is the person that rings up your order and in our instance, she directly brought us the credit card slip to sign. As we are signing it, she proceeds to look over our shoulder and 'suggest' what we should leave. Who does that? I am all about tipping appropriately but in this instance, we had had a terrible waiter who forgot about us. He was definitely not getting 20% but the woman was trying to argue with us. This is unacceptable to me - no employee at a restaurant should tell you what to tip. So that is why I am left with a bad taste in my mouth from S&G and I will NOT be going back.

I have been looking for a great diner in Chicago.... anyone could have a fabulous breakfast here.  It isn't fancy - but it is great food and good service!  and it is a perfect walk from Roscoe Village.... nice to stretch your legs!  If they had grits, it would have been 5 stars.  Certainly will be back!!  I had the ham and cheese croissant and my friend had the Porky's Cousin and said it was great!  Yummy fresh squeezed OJ as well!  Thanks!

Loved going here for breakfast. For the number of times I've been across the street at Golden Apple, I never noticed this place and am glad I finally did! Everyone who worked there was friendly and really brightened my morning. It's a neighborhood place so there were a lot of familes out, and you can tell there are some people who come here every week. I had the combo skillet which was great, and I don't usually order breakfast food. Extra bonus: green tobasco sauce. Will def be back.

This place has been around since 1951 and you can tell why. It looks kinda dingy when you walk in, pretty much like it's still stuck in the 50's and I'm pretty sure some of the regulars have been coming since then opened too. However, the workers are really nice and the food was great. Breakfast is the way to go. They have an impressive selection of 'Egg Casseroles' which is just a fancy way to say skillets. I got the Godfather... Sautéed Onions, Sliced Italian Sausage, Mozzarella Cheese, and Topped off with Two Eggs any style for $9.75. Considering I was almost too hungover to keep my eyes open, this was the perfect hangover helper. Greasy and delicious.  All the burgers come with a large plate of fries and soup. I ate the giant bowl of chicken and wild rice soup. It was delicious and you could tell it was prepared fresh.  Basically, this place is the perfect hangover spot and I hope it sticks around for another 50 years. I can't wait to come here when I'm old and tell stories how I puked in the bathroom when I was 25 years old.
Most amazing and exhaustive choice of skillets. A must for breakfast in the city.
Limitless selection; they even have chorizo! Good service, nice atmosphere, fair prices. They are always welcoming. This is my favorite breakfast place in the city!

This place is solid enough. I dig the skillets, and the biscuits and gravy are delish. The atmosphere and service, meh. The elderly couple next to us asked the waitress to help with their wobbly table, and she kinda handed him a handful of napkins and shrugged (I took care of it). My glass of water had a plastic or glass shard in it. They never brought me my toast. Basically, it's not a bad option if you don't anticipate needing anything else once you get your food, but I wouldn't call it a fantastic brunch. However, it's right by us now, and I'm sure we'll end up trying it again. I'm keeping an open mind and hoping for a better overall experience next time.
great and  filling skillets that are wonderful, I can eat and couldn't finish it. Why 4 instead of 5 stars- because its a cardiologists nightmare or delight

Went here because it was on the top list for Yelp for breakfast.  It was a huge disappointment.  It was like an old timer Denny's.  Everyone was very friendly, but I think I would prefer iHop... and I don't really like iHop.
corned beef hash was undercooked and kinda gross.  the service was awesome, but yeah, i'd avoid the corned beef hash.

S & G is mine and my boyfriend's favorite place for breakfast in the city. Everything we've had has always been fresh and delicious. The food always arrives quickly and the super friendly staff makes you feel at home.  We will always love this place and will continue to come here till the day we die!

So we originally went to the Golden Apple across the street but we were not impressed by the menu or fellow patrons. I kind of felt like an ass just getting up and leaving after we already sat down, but S&G's seemed better so we went for it. The awkwardness was well worth it. The menu is much better, there were far less screaming children and the outdoor space was a lot better. Our waitress was really nice and attentive and the breakfast burrito was delicious.

So, I had the Greek Nachos and as expected, they were delicious.  I also had a standard eggs, bacy, hashbys breakfast this time and it was more delicious that a place you'd usually go even though it's just 2 eggs and the like. The food is amazing, but this place has their crap together in every way.  They really know how to run a breakfast/lunch/diner-type restaurant.  They are lightening fast, always friendly and welcoming and the place is clean.  During this last visit, I saw two separate employees cleaning (around the breakfast counter and food pick-up window) which made me feel good about the all around cleanliness of the place.  But, the point is, the staff is hard working and they seem to operate on a "time to lean?  time to clean." policy. I love this place.  Best breakfast in the city all things considered.  Kudos to the staff and owner(s)!
Wow- SUPER friendly, super fast (even on the patio), and INCREDIBLE food.  HUGE portions (try the Athenian Egg Casserole- a crazy amount of gyro included!).  I will absolutely go back.

I really LOVE these types of diner-y breakfast places: huge menu, no frills, and just really good breakfast food. I got the eggie and veggie casserole (skillet) which was huge and filled with potatoes, eggs, cheese, and lots of veggies. I told myself before I started eating that I should only eat half and take the rest to go, but next thing I knew, my plate was completely clean. My fiancee got a turkey club, and he said it was just okay. Honestly, I just don't go to places like this for lunch. I go because of the creative breakfast menu and tons of options.  There was no wait at about 1pm on a Saturday, and the service was attentive and quick. It seems like the kind of place where they really get to know the regulars- they were asking people questions about their families, jobs, etc. They also showed us the weekday breakfast specials, which are basically just really good deals on breakfast food (like bacon, eggs, potatoes, and fruit for $6). This is not the type of place where you're going to find fancy menu items and even fancy service, but for what it is, it is awesome.  There's also a patio, if this review was enough to convince you to just GO.

One of the most well-run restaurants I've seen in Chicago.  They handle a large of amount of traffic with ease, you always feel cared for and attended to, and they're still able to make and serve food quickly and with great service. Most reviews here mention their breakfast but the menu is 10 pages long and has a ton of lunch and dinner options.  Don't sleep on the burgers -- on my last visit I ate one of the best patty melts I've ever had.

Is this a diner...yes! But for a diner its great.  They are always super friendly even if you have never been in there before.  The food is always good and comes out so quick.  The service is great even on the weekends when they are busy.  Good reliable diner in Chicago.  This is the place.

WOO-HOO!!  We finally have another local diner!  Once upon a time there was this fantastic diner right across the street from us on Ashland.  Alas & alack, it succumbed to two ghastly condo projects leaving us with no place to heal a hangover. While it might be more of a walk to S & G than our previous joint, it's so worth it.  When we went every table was full and only 2 seats open at the counter.  But we only had to wait for about 3 minutes before a table opened and we were seated.  We were greeted warmly and genuinely by both the cashier/hostess & the owner/chef.  The wait and bus staff were all just as friendly.  Skillets were the order of the morning and they were excellent, filling to the point of not being able to finish. The most impressive experience was not ours but one we witnessed.  A couple was seated two tables away from us.  They were sitting there for a pretty significant period of time without being approached by a server.  Ordinarily, I'd say that's unacceptable.  But to be fair, the place was sardine-packed and there are times when a turned table gets overlooked.  A manager approached them and asked if a server had taken their order.  They politely said no.  The manager apologized and assured them someone would be right over.  She left their table and went directly to a server.  That server immediately went to the table, also apologizing, taking their order, and placing it (I had a full view of the kitchen pickup window).  Then the chef/owner came over, apologized and said that their breakfast would be on him.  Their breakfast was expedited and they were dining within 5-7 minutes of placing their order. How hard was that?  This is customer service!

A great neighborhood diner!! Food is always reliable, hot and good. Service is always, quick, attentive and friendly. I love their breakfast. My favorite is the vegetarian egg while omelette - and their greek toast is awesome!! Only reason why this place didn't get five stars from me is all of the knick knacks/memorabilia hanging around - I'm a bit OCD and get overstimulated by random hanging things - while it is not overwhelming or as terrible as I am making it seem, I still have a hard time with weird staff that doesn't match! LOL - but really, this is more my problem than theirs. So, I'm a bit strange, that's fine. Bottom line - good food, friendly, family run place! Enjoy!

I was almost too hung over to eat, but this was one of the best breakfasts I have ever consumed. I had the combo skillet, which had the most veggies, but also had breakfast meats--no brainer. I subbed Greek toast for plain, and I'm glad that I did. The owner seemed to love what he was doing; he was really fun and friendly and gave attention to every patron.  This place has a very heavy traffic flow, and I know why. The food was seriously amazing and service was attentive, albeit rushed. A lot of places that busy with such high table turnover lose track of what they say they will do for you. The servers here may forget for a few minutes, but as soon as they see you, they remember and provide you what you need. Five stars, all day, every day.

It's home cooked meal with great service. I've been coming here now for over 2 years and they never disappoint. Excellent b'fast skillets, omelettes, they dinner specials are excellent (baked ribs are a must try). Comfy food at its best!

Fresh squeezed orange juice: great but I wish it was pulpier. I got the avacado egg casserol with a Greek toast-the skillet was filled with hashbrowns, avocado and topped with melted cheese and eggs to top it off. This was a huge plate and wasn't sure if I would like avocados for breakfast, but I absolutely loved it. A huge plate for the price. This place was pretty busy and it seems like they get a lot of the usual customers. It was a nice place for breakfast.

This place is great! I ordered sandwiches from here, the corned beef and Reuben as well as the club. Great split pea soup and salad. I also had the coconut cream pie and it was delicious!!!!  I have heard great things about their breakfast as well. Great diner type of atmosphere and decently priced
Love s&g.  Come and eat here!

We go to S&G's pretty regularly. Their breakfast is delicious. They have egg skillets that are out of this world. Their orange juice is great too! The owners are greek, so they have some yummy lemon-rice soup. Youre usually served a bread basket when you sit down too. Gets pretty packed on Saturday/Sunday mornings, so dont be surprised if you have to wait a little. Would recommend to anyone
Great food and has the personal touch so many places lack. John and staff are great.

This place was packed for Sunday brunch.  While that isn't surprising for Chicago, I was expecting better food given the crowd.   It was very much what you think of when it comes to "diner" food.  Lots of egg options - fried in butter and covered in cheese.   For the area  - Wishbone, Nookies, and Harmony grill are all better options.

I'm sure this place is BUSY in the mornings.  It wasn't packed mid-afternoon on a cold Saturday, but there were still customers - and even regulars. Service was good and the owners were there - the little old lady tending the register and acting as hostess, the old man walking around and talking to customers.   Coffee was tasty, but the fresh OJ is where its at!  I had a skillet... always a good diner staple.  The food came quickly - its an "in and out" place.

First and foremost - this place is unapologetically dive-y. The decorations are thumb tacked to the walls and a cold draft whips through the unsealed windows out front. Upon sitting down, I noticed that my knife still has food on it that the dishwasher clearly didn't take care of. All of that being said, the food was pretty good. I had a standard breakfast of over easy eggs, sourdough toast, and sausage patties. All of which were fine although the texture of the sausage was a bit suspect. I'm in no rush to go back to Sam & George's but I'm not avoiding it either.

Ended up here when the place we were intending to go was closed, but glad we did! Skillets galore, this is definitely your local diner that everyone is happy to hang out in over a great breakfast.  The owner was walking around, giving his regards to the regulars sheltering from the cold over coffee and eggs.   Quick food, good service, and friendly people; not nearly close enough to me to be a regular choice, I would certainly go back if I was in the area!

This is a great place for breakfast or brunch. I had the egg casserole with hashbrowns, green peppers, onions, cheese and tomatoes and some eggs-to-order on top. It was spicy and good! I was pleasantly surprised. Classic diner atmosphere and the staff is awesome.

I always come to Sam and George's before hitting the Lincoln Tap Room for burlesque shows on the occasional Friday night. I'm always greeted by either the owner or a happy little woman working the front counter and then served by an extremely nice waitress who knows what I like to order every time. Sam and George's is inexpensive, awesome diner food with great deals--Great cream of potato soup and also a hefty basket of bread and crackers. They have a simple, yet tasty BLT with avocado and a delicious avocado, lettuce, tomato, and cheese club sandwich. Yum! Again, extremely affordable and an overall very friendly environment. Fast, too! One of my favorite diners in Chicago.

What an awesome cure for a New Years' Day hangover! Sam and George's is an unassuming yet justifiably crowded diner. The staff handles the throngs well; turnover is quick, and despite a line out the door we waited for less than 10 minutes. The food was delicious - I had a skillet with hash browns, green peppers, onion, skirt steak, and two eggs over easy. It was a little greasy, but this is a large part of the reason for it being such an excellent hangover cure, so I'll definitely allow it. Pricing was pretty unbeatable ($10.95 for a breakfast involving steak is practically unheard of in this city). I'll be back often!
Fantastic food! I found my new breakfast place in the neighborhood. Courteous staff and a great atmosphere.

I have passed this place often and decided to stop in for breakfast.  My first impression was that this place was full of "regulars".  The staff were friendly and seemed to promote a family environment.  I loved how the staff would stop and chit chat with the customers like they were old friends.  Now on top of all of that the food was just good ole breakfast food.   I think I may go back so that I can become a regular.

Great neighborhood place with a good ole diner feel. Seriously, the man behind the counter greeted almost everyone who walked in by name, and there were pictures of all the regulars and their children and grandchildren tacked onto the wall. Super cute.  My friend and I stumbled here courtesy of Yelp after learning that Costco doesn't open til 10 (we showed up at 9), and we weren't disappointed by the food, either. They're kind enough to warn you that it's all cooked in real butter, but it's a good menu with solid diner options.  And I just love the community vibe

S&G's is a classic diner!  Think Monk's on Seinfeld.  We went for breakfast and found an abundance of skillet options.  The food was excellent and the service terrific.  The owner walks around talking with diners and acts like he's known you for years.  This is worth trying!

I have found a new favorite brunch spot. From the diner-y feel, to the personable staff, to the MASSIVE egg casseroles, Sam and George's is a keeper. S & G's will inevitably deter my goal of trying a new brunch place every weekend and I will be lured back for round two.  First of all, our party of four was mesmerized by the never-ending menu, so many options! Looking back, it is laughable that my starving boyfriend with a very large appetite contemplated ordering an egg casserole AND a breakfast burrito. These are both seriously enormous. I had the Porky Pig egg casserole and it was phenomenal. He had the one with the chicken tenders, biscuits, and gravy and let me know it was "hear-stoppingly good." We also shared a chocolate malt which was delicious, but I would recommend sharing this to leave room for your egg casserole. This meal left all of us with cured hangovers and in food comas for the rest of the day. We will definitely be returning to try more of the menu.
Amazing. Never disappointed in the egg skillets. Pig in a blanket are fantastic. Good service. Local people. Not screaming children everywhere. Love S & G!
Meh. It has "diner" feel, but the food is below par. It is the kind of place where the owner will not care too much about this review (good or bad.)
Great egg scrambles and great service.  Much better than Golden Apple.
This is some of the best diner food on the north side. And the service is fantastic. Definitely recommend stopping in here for breakfast or lunch.

No surprises here. And that is awesome. It's an awesome little gem that has amazing service, an extensive menu and it's quiet. Perfect for a quiet cup of coffee or a hearty lunch or dinner. Everyone is friendly and the food is hearty comfort food.

I went to S&G this morning and it was average at best. With all the options in Chicago, I don't feel any need to go back.  The diner is kind of nice. You get that old school feeling of a family owned joint, but the food is really nothing special. I ordered a skillet that was very bland. My father ordered a combo plate of eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast. We both left with the same blah opinion.

What kind of a fantastic dream world am I currently living in, where I am surrounded by such amazing breakfast places?  Oh that's right.  CHICAGO.  AND IT ISN'T A DREAM. This morning, it was decided that breakfast was in order.  Since it has become my goal to try not to eat at the same place twice* we headed to Sam and George's for breakfast this morning.  As did like, most people in our neighborhood, I think, because the place was packed.  Still, we were seated in minutes.   The service was fast a friendly, and the menu is extensive and full of awesome.  Lots of people here have mentioned the Egg Casseroles.  They're great!  Don't get me wrong, I love an omelette as much as the next girl who values the meal of breakfast anytime of day more than most things in life, but I also love the concept of throwing everything you love about breakfast, minus toast (which comes on the side) into one skillet, topping that with cheese and eggs ANY WAY YOU WANT THEM, and making everyone's morning 50% brighter (you're on your own for that other 50% pal). I definitely want to come back.  Such a comfortable atmosphere, even though it was insanely busy, but definitely a place where you could be a regular.  And by you I mean me.  Let's do it. *It's not working, since there are so many places I've gone back to, ut to try new things, so it kinda counts!

Egg Casseroles you say?  YES.  Sam and George's Egg Casseroles are appreciated by my mouth and stomach.  It sounds weird at first.  Picture this: Hash brown Base with all your favorite breakfast toppings - use your imagination because they have about 15 specialty egg casseroles ranging from Gyro meat to Denver style.  Then top off 2 eggs any style, served in a small skillet.  I recommend the Spartan, delish!  Before eating you can either mix it up or eat through the layers.  It's a pretty decent size so you can always share with someone else.   S & G's is nestled on a quaint corner in Chicago's much respected and cherished Lakeview neighborhood.  Upon arrival you are either always greeted by one of the owners or someone else just as lovely.  This place literally feels like home, as if your uncles had a restaurant and you got the run of the place.  Most of the wait staff is a mix of older ladies that REALLY run the joint.  It's like all your favorite schoolteachers and aunts retired and starting waiting tables here.  It literally feels like the best place on earth.  By no means is it fancy; there appears no renovation since the early 80s, that doesn't mean it's not up to par with every other place.  If you serve the food like S & G's does I'd gladly sit in a cardboard box and have no shame.  It's absolutely divine people.  Do yourself a favor.

Sam and George's is always busy on a Saturday or Sunday morning, but they can always seat you quickly.  They have great service and a wide variety of food.  I love that they bring a little carafe of soda or tea for each individual.  The same servers are there each weekend and they are always in a good mood.  I love the chicken rice soup!  I've gone here 4 times in the past 6 weeks.  It's great and I'm glad I live so close to it!

All I wanted this morning was a yummy breakfast.  I'd say that I got a pretty yummy breakfast at S&G today.  My pancakes, though perfectly not too thick or thin with sweet strawberries on top, were sadly the slightest bit burned on the bottom.  Anyone who's made pancakes knows the slightest burn makes pancakes not so yummy.  Our waitress was super nice and I liked the family owned feel of the place. Maybe I need to give this place another try?

Love this place!  I had some sort of skillet. Oh man was it good and right in my price range, cheap! This is not a place to go if you want to be coddled and wooed through your meal. But! if you're looking for a good brunch/breakfast(is anyone awake for that?) and you can pull yourself out of bed before the post church crowd arrives, eat here!

I am obsessed with breakfast skillets.  these were fairly ordinary and they didnt have a ton of meat in them.  but they do have like 20 different options.  i got the combo skillet.   staff was very friendly kept my coffee cup full
Nice place for breakfast. Reminds you of a classic diner with excellent food and service. The folks are so nice here. The meals were served quickly and the menu is gerat
wonderful brunch, really nice outdoor seating area, fast service. great diner that is run by great people!

A regular in the community for years. Consistent in quality, which is always great. John, the owner, is wonderful. Very accommodating to those w/kids. Great Eggs Benedict, Biscuits & Gravy, soups, etc.

Simply put, my wife and I go here EVERY weekend because we want to support the owners of this place.  John, the owner, who is there everyday is probably the nicest guy and takes so much pride in his work and truly touches every piece of the business (we saw him on Monday sweeping the sidewalk) that this place is a must for us.  FAST service...GREAT prices, and VERY GOOD diner food.  It's quick, good food and you will want to support this place after having eaten here. By the way, I usually get breakfast, but the Turkey Club is awesome...and it's carved turkey not deli sliced turkey.  Solid!

AKA Sam & George, whatever you call it, you will certainly enjoy the food.  This is a true story.  I was visiting the area because my wife and I will be transferring from Houston next year.  I was about 75% sure I wanted to move to this place until I visited this restaurant.  Now, I am absolutely 100% positive I want to live in this city.  These people made that big of an impression on my family and I!  The food was great and the staff was magnificent!  This is going to be a regular hangout for us during our visits and we will continue going after we move there.

I was looking for a place to grab some breakfast this morning and I came across S&G's on yelp. I was in the area so I decided to stop in. It was a great experience from the moment I walked in until the moment I left. The entire staff was extremely friendly and attentive and the food was delicious. It was my first time here and it definitely won't be my last. If you're in the area stop by and check it out for yourself. You won't be disappointed!

Brunch much?  Well if you do this is the perfect place to go with friends and family.  They have a huge selection to choose from and everything is delicious!  This is a family dinner that makes you feel as if you are a part of the family. This place is about food not about being a part of the scene. John is great and his daughter is a sweet as pie!  The service is always great even if there is a long line.  Warning: if you go here and it's hard to go anywhere else.

I love this place for breakfast/brunch.  Everyone who works there is incredibly nice and makes you feel at home.  The skillets are huge and delicious and the perfect way to get your day started (especially if you had a little too much fun the night before).

Greatest place ever!!!  Weve been here a multitude of times and every time it gets better.  We have had groups ranging from 3 people to 15 people and the service is incredible everytime.  The skillets are amazing and will cure any hangover almost immediatly.  Last time we were there someone in my group ordered the breakfast burritos and the owner informed us that he was unfortunatly out of tortillas.  He felt so bad that he brought the whole table 3 huge plates of fresh fruit on the house.  I cant wait to go back again!!!

I should have known better when the other reviews rave about this place's brunch, but nothing on dinner. Well it wasn't like we were planning on going here. We tumbled across S&G because the other restaurant closed without a warning and my boyfriend was about to pass out from hunger. The place was empty, but it was also 6:00pm on a Saturday afternoon. We sat outside and enjoyed the nice weather. The waitress came over momentarily and bought us 2 glasses and a huge bottle of water - a plus for her. Now since the man was about to pass out - I didn't even have a chance to look at their extensive menu - I was forced to order right away!  I got a mushroom burger and he got a reuben sandwich. The interesting part was the meal comes with fries and soups, and pickles. We told the waitress to bring out the soup right away or else someone might lose conscious. She was taken back but seemed to understand.  However that was unnecessary. Within 2 minutes the waitress came back with our soups, plenty of crackers, and some dinner rolls with butter. When we started burying our face in the food, she quickly came back with our sandwich, burgers and fries. So within 5 minutes of ordering, we literally covered our table with foods. There was enough food to feed 4 people, not 2.  Even though I was very impressed with the quick services, and very much enjoyed the soups and rolls, my burger was yucky! Yes, yucky! It tasted like old frozen patty near its expiration date. I ate not even 1/2 or it, but I was so full from everything else. My boyfriend's sandwich was a little bit better, but the sauerkraut was tooo sour, another yuck!  Everything was cheap - and for the amount of food it was very cheap. I wish I had gone with something else rather than a burger. Probably will be back here for a bruch, but not dinner.
Awsome Skillets.  Love the family owned atmosphere.   I feel good spending my money here.

This joint would have gotten 5 stars if it wasn't for some rough/tough mustachioed man working the register. The way he talked to his female employees was demeaning. But their skillets are f--king great, y'all.  So it gets four stars. Work on your attitude, mister.

POISONED. POISONED1 What planet were people on when they rated this place. I sat myself down.  I had to wait over 10 minutes to be served.  I ordered the daily special (meatloaf sandwich with soup).  Waited over 15 minutes to get the soup.  A different waitress gave me my soup.  The soup had no flavor.  Had to add lots of salt.  Crackers were beyond stale.   Waitress never came to me to ask how the meal was.  Waited another 15 minutes for my meatloaf sandwich.  Again, another server gave me this part of my meal.  I thought I went to hell and back.  Instant mash potatoes with no flavor.  Packaged gravy that had not been seasoned.  I took two bites of the meatloaf and almost died.  The meatloaf had some green specks in it, and it did not taste right.  No one ever asked me how the meal was.  I had to ask the bus person for my check. The cashier who, also,had been one of my servers never asked how the meal was. I feel I should not have paid for the meal.  I should have been reimbursed. I am lucky I did not die from this meal. IF YOU WANT POOR SERVICE,  FOOD POISONING, COME TO THIS DINER.  IT IT BEYOND ME THAT THEY ARE IN BUSINESS.

I love S&Gs! A true Chicago gem. My boyfriend and I would come here after work around 5 AM, which is dinner time for us. They had no problem serving us fresh chili and steak sandwiches at a time when everyone else was sleepily ordering their first cup of coffee. Everything, I mean EVERYTHING on the menu is delicious and made with love. The service is excellent. I always end up giving at least a 50% tip. This place feels like home. Oh, for anyone who likes hot sauce with their breakfast skillets, ask for the homemade salsa. It's amazing. S&Gs, don't ever change!
hands down the best breakfast and service in the city.  John is the best!

What's not to love-- great food, great prices, nice people who don't have their noses out of joint. Any time there is even a slight issue, it's quickly remedied. I'm in love.  They should have a frequent diner card. I'd have that punched VERY FREQUENTLY!

I swear I already wrote a review for this place (oh yeah...see "Sam & George's), but I will take this opportunity to sing my praises once again.  My husband and I are now official regulars at this diner. Even though we moved a couple miles north a year ago, we are still here pretty much every weekend (and if we miss a weekend,  we make it a point to come back twice the next weekend). The waitresses and busboys are now old friends. We are obsessed with the skillets, which come out perfect every time - crispy hash browns and gooey melted cheese - and there's a whole page of them to choose from, although we end up getting the same ones each time ("Sean's Favorite" for him and "the Athenian" for me with a side of tzatsiki sauce). Get here early if you want to get seated pretty quickly - otherwise it gets packed and there is not much standing room.
Very friendly, family run diner. The skillets are tasty! A little pricy, but totally worth it!

GREAT place. The atmosphere is great - you can tell this is a family-run, close-knit kind of place. It is always hopping on the weekends for breakfast, but there is rarely longer than a few minute wait.  We love their English Muffins - they are HUGE! And delicious. Also love their skillet casseroles, especially the one called Porky's Cousin. Great place; highly recommended!

We had to wait a bit for a table, but it was Sunday brunch and extremely busy, so that is understandable. The service was very quick. I have only been for breakfast, but the food was solid, American diner fare. It is not gourmet, nor is this restaurant receiving a Michelin star anytime soon, but it was good. I would definitely go back here again for a casual breakfast or brunch.

Yes, this is a diner. Yes, the owner maybe knows your name. The service? It comes quick.  These are nice things about the place. But let me tell you, the food. The food was so far from fresh, that i had to stop eating. Don't expect fresh fruits with your pancakes or waffles. You will get processed, canned fruits. My friend ordered a skillet that came with mushrooms. The mushrooms looked and tasted like they were made out of some sort of rubber material. My other friend almost got sick during eating his skillet. They need to work on getting fresher ingredients.  I would not recommend this place for food. Their service and coffee is great. But their food.... is terrible.

I can defininitely see why Sam & George's has a lot of fans, big selection of breakfast, cozy diner atmosphere and some very friendly staff Its always a good thing when the owner knows almost all his customers frequent refills of coffee, hearty food, i know i'll be back

Solid joint for skillet lovers.  They offer many varieties.  Super friendly staff and a great Greek owner who reminds me of the Coney Island owners back in Detroit.  Can get pretty crowded during the burnching hours but if you're an early bird, you shouldn't have any issues. I'll say it's a half a step up in price from a lot of other breakfast joints, but nothing bad.  You won't pay $12 for French Toast like the Bongo Room. If I lived in the 'hood, this would be my regular spot.  Sadly, I save it for special occasions.

Scenario - I'm pregnant and husband is hungover as all hell.  We both have cravings which need to be satisfied: Me: grapefruit half and breakfast skillet. Him:  breakfast skillet. Enter - S&G which we decide to try for the first time  Apparently it's very crowded on weekend mornings but since we went at 3pm on a Sunday, no problem.  I got the avocado skillet and was a bit leery.  You know it's a gamble to order avocado sight unseen from a new place!!  But it was delicious - the avocados were green and bountiful!! Drunky Mcdrunkerson got the gypsy skillet and a side of hashbrowns.  Our waitress was kind enough to clarify that the skillet "already came with hashbrowns" and did this in a non-judgemental way.  He devoured it in silence and then slumped backwards happily in the booth.  Mission accomplished. Bonus - they have both Frank's Red Hot and Choulula sauce at the tables.   My coffee cup was always full, and they gave us a carafe of water...double bonus. We talked to George on the way out, although not really sure about what.  The grapefruit and the people watching, for the record, were also incredible.

This is my kind of place for breakfast on a weekend morning or lunch on a weekday.  The service is top-notch, from the busboys to the waitresses to the owner/manager (who had me in stitches minutes after walking in).  I was offered coffee and a paper to read while waiting for my breakfast date to arrive, which is a nice touch.  (something about reading the paper at breakfast is just so...right) The menu is huge but take your time and find what you want.  For me, it's usually an egg casserole, although the biscuits and gravy are making a strong push for the lead.  It's not some joint where you are going to get off-the-wall ingredients and French-fushion mumbo jumbo.  You're going to get tasty, fresh breakfast food.   S&G's!!

It has been two days since my first visit to Sam & George's and I'm still (STILL!) drooling over my corned beef and swiss cheese omelet.  Instead of celebrating {unofficial} St. Pat's, I decided to plan a nice little Saturday which included doggie errands and breakfast with one of my favorite partners-in-food. He suggested Sam & George, which I never even knew existed until last week. The exterior is very unassuming but the interior is a classic and homey diner.  The coffee was decent, but a bit weak (and I'm not particular about my coffee), and the menu was huuuuge! It took me a long time to decide what I wanted to eat because I was super hungry and wanted to order one of everything! Ok, truth be told, I almost did.  I ordered a half-order of biscuits and gravy, a side of bacon, and the above mentioned corned beef and swiss cheese omelet that came with a side of hash browns and your choice of toast. I went with pumpernickel, but I've heard that the greek bread is to die for. All of the food was simple, delicious, and hearty. I want to eat here every day!  This was real comfort food and will be my go-to breakfast spot from now on.

This place is awesome! I only just heard about it recently and through reading Yelp reviews. I don't get how it only has 14 reviews (15, counting this one) and people say they have been going here for years. Maybe it's sort of a well kept secret... Well, the secret is out! If you like breakfast any time, like I do, then get yourself to S & G. The breakfast skillets are "hella" good (yes, i used that word... don't get use to it). If you don't like awesomeness in a skillet or are watching your figure, then maybe you can try some of their waffles... with ice cream. Ok, so maybe this isn't the place if you're trying to shed a few lbs. I also love that this place won't break the bank. Good food and good prices. That's what I'm talking about. So, go and try S & G. You can always start your diet tomorrow.
Good ol school diner eggs,bacon,coffee whatever you need,they treat you like family here.I have been eating here for years,Thanks John,Frannie and Princess.

This is my absolute favorite brunch spot! The service is always great, it's almost like a cheers-esque vibe, since they always remember you and  treat you like a VIP customer, but without a pretentious attitude.  This is right near my apt. and my fiance, roomates and family have come to call this place a home away from home.  A few of my favorite things about Sam & George's include: The hobo skillet, the fast seating, their bagels, fast service and the fact that they are always open- EVEN on the biggest snow storm in Chicago! It's a must.

The boyfriend and I decided to brave the blizzards aftermath and much to our delight S&G was open!  I love this place!  I've been coming here since I moved to the city(three years ago) and today just confirmed it! John (the owner) had been there all night and he was still on top of his game. Making friends with everyone including the snow plow men and serving great food. He was up early making their special corned beef and cabbage. Now I am a corn beef and cabbage snob and this was some of the best I've ever had. Sorry mom. Big shout out to Fran as well. She always keeps us laughing throughout our meal. Favorite restaurant in the city by far!!

This is hands down my favorite place to eat any meal in the city.  The people could not be more friendly and the food is consistently delicious! I went there this morning (Blizzard of 2011) and much to my delight, they were open for business!  I can't stress enough how wonderful this place it- if you're looking for great food and a great friendly atmosphere, this is the place for you!
This place is golden.  I love it.  Friendly owner and employees, pretty good grub, old school patrons, well-loved regulars...this is a slice of what Chicago used to be like.  Strongly recommended.

You know the best part about S&G?  What makes it stand out from other brunch places in Chicago?  You get what you ask for! I think it's awesome when you can ask for something special, and the folks at S&G make it happen.  You can ask for chilled syrup, or egg whites with no oil, or bacon sprinkled atop your waffle, or whatever your heart desires!  S&G delivers. The menu is really large, so it's a great place to come with a big group.  Also a great place to come hungover (but I wouldn't know anything about that...so you must try the experiment yourself :-).
Really enjoyed my corn beef hash skillet; it was very filling :)
Flat out amazing. I love this place. My second tome here and the owner personally sat us again and was really cool. No better place to grab breakfast!

Been coming to good old S & G for years!!!!  I haven't been here in a while, but decided one Sunday morning to give it a whirl!  Now with all breakfast spots, DO ARRIVE early to avoid the yuppie family's strolling with kids, strollers, and then they take over the place.  Since when do parents not crack a kid anymore, but they allow them to roam around free, and even coming up to me going "what are you eating?"  And the kid puts his damn finger on my food.  That little sh*t!!!!  & the parent goes "hey buddy don't touch the man's food".  um, jerkface.......your kids hand was in my food!    I go "hey i'd like you to replace my breakfast"  He goes "excuse me?"  i go "how can I eat this after your kids fingers were all in it?"  I stood up and I looked down at the little 135lb yuppie......as he then goes "oh oh oh ok sir, not a problem" 3 stars for the food........not good on coffee refills & that is key for me for breakfast.  Take care of me, I'll tip ya good!

Excellent Greek Diner type Breakfast Spot - you won't be disappointed.  With so many choices in the Lakeview/Lincoln Park/Wrigleyville Area....we keep going back to S&G again and again whenever we are in town.

Awesome breakfast spot!  Very pleasant atmosphere with nice staff. Ordered the athenian skillet and it was pretty awesome. Lots of selections on the menu and food seemed fresh. Great service and overall great experience! Definitely will go back for more!!!
Excellent food, no unreasonable waits, and extremely friendly service.  Really can't ask for more.  I recommend the skillets (or, Egg Casseroles, as they are called)!  My favorite is the rajun cajun.

This is a staple, traditional dinery nook.  It's been here forever, you can tell, family pictures behind the counter and the owner ( I would guess) and waitress calling guests by name and asking about their business. "The usual?" you might hear... Comfy counter seating was perfect for me, occupied with a book and a cup-a coffee.  Omelette and toast was perfect for a cheap price.  Go by yourself for with someone else... s'all good.  Ay, it's a diner!

Ok, this is a review for their brunch, I've never eaten there any other time: 1) Great food at a good price 2) Diner experience and they don't try to ever be anything else 3) Family run business and they treat anyone who walks in like family 4) Their menu is rediculous, I love the breakfast menu, I can get ANYTHING.  sometimes i want to be healthy so I do the egg whites and they will cook it how I ask.  Othertimes I'm hungover and I need one of their skillets which are PHENOM.
